He succumbed to the seemingly easy way as did his allies. They lived in the hell they had created on their own ...
Surrounded by treacherous allies, always fearing betrayal, always in need to prove themselves, never being able to show any weakness without someone trying to seize upon that opportunity ...
A Nightmare Knight would hold his ground in a battle against impossible odds just to cover the retreat of his friends ...

A member of the Brotherhood does try to run if the tide of battle seems to turn against him, since he can safely assume that the others will run too and those who run last will be those who suffer most ...
This is why they ultimately failed. Their failure did not save our own order though.

Necromancy is like a disease that spreads through your soul. By studying the dark art you learn to perceive life and death in a different unhealthy way. Both become tools you use as it pleases you ...
You lose your respect for life and death alike. In the end you have abandoned all that is worth living for. You will end off in a dark, decaying world of your own making ...
You will have minions and masters, but no friends. You will know power and submission, but no fulfilment.

There is no power. Nowhere ever. There is only responsibility. To think about responsibility as power is already the first step into the wrong direction.
They are mighty individuals that survived for aeons in the merciless society of demons. This alone is proof enough of how dangerous they are ...

It put an example other demons followed with more or less success ...

But they cannot truly understand the concept of helping each other, so in the long run their alliance is doomed to fail. They will end up devouring each other, for they cannot stand the thought that others may wield power, too ...
But then, we are mere mortals and this day might be far away. So we will have to deal with them either way. ...
Still it is possible that one of them can be attacked without the six others interfering on his behalf, since this, after all, is the way of demonkind.

A strong spirit is what constitutes a true warrior. Armed with a firm belief in his philosophy, he wins a battle by using his mind rather than his body, which is only a lesser tool ...

In the end your body is all but a crumbling shell that you leave behind. Our familiarity with dreams makes it much easier to understand this concept since in the world of dreams your body follows the will of the mind ...
The conscious mind shapes the matter of the dreams. Only those who can prove themselves in their dreams posses the strength of mind that is necessary to become one of us ...
Still a strong mind does not necessarily grant strong morals as our failures in the past have shown.

I'm the officer responsible for this area. I give out missions, accept mission reports and oversee our defences.
The levels around us are... well, they are strange. We are still not entirely sure how they were created. It seems obvious that they are artificial, but they seem not to be burrowed or the like. ...

We found strange stone formations that were not found on other layers around the Spike, but there is no clue at all if they are as natural as they look. It seems someone used some geomantic force to move the earth. ...
For what reason this has been done we can't tell as we found no clues of colonisation. ...

There are theories that the caves are some kind of burrow of some extinct creature or even creatures that are still around us, but exist as some form of invisible energy; but those theories are far-fetched and not supported by any discoveries. ...

Be that as it may, whatever those caves were meant for, these days they are crawling with creatures of different kinds and all are hostile towards us. The competition for food is great down here, and everything is seen as prey by the cave dwellers. ...

Some would like to feast on the crystal of the Spike, others would prefer a diet of gnomes. What they have in common is that they are a threat. If we can't keep them under control their constant attacks and raids on the Spike will wear us down. ...
That's where adventurers fit in to save the day.
Sorry, but no! Your expertise could be put to better use elsewhere. Here awaits you no challenge. You are desperately needed in the deeper levels of the Spike. Report there immediately.
What mission do you want to report about: the gathering of geomantic charges, the task to fertilise the mushroom caves, the destroying of monster nests or the killing of crystal crushers?

Yet another wonder conceived by brilliant gnomish minds. I envy you to be here with us. If I were not a gnome, the next best thing I could imagine is to be here, with us. You must be so thrilled and grateful.
They might be small but still they are not gnomes. Actually, they are rather odd people. I get along better with you humans.
Gnomes have lived autonomous for so long that it still feels odd to work with strangers for many of us.
I wonder if it hurts to be a human. I mean ... you are so ... stretched!
Gnomebase Alpha does its best to supply us with goods, but we thrive and strive to become completely independent. Already we can send some raw materials back to them.
Dangerous but cowardly. In the end we will prevail. They will likely give up eventually.
Good bye Player and take care.
Salutations, Player! I guess you are here for the horses.
I can rent you a horse for a day or I can transport you with a coach.
Do you want to rent a horse for one day at a price of 500 gold?
We can bring you to Thais with one of our coaches for 125 gold. Are you interested?

Most dwarfs don't like riding at all. Though I heard one of their heroes is riding a ram, they usually use horses and donkeys as beasts of burden. Given their size it is not astounding that they prefer the smaller donkeys over the horses.
Did you know that minotaurs ride giant bulls? It seems somewhat strange, like a human riding a cyclops.
There is nothing big enough for a cyclops to ride.
Venore is the heart of trade and commerce. Not even Thais can rival Venore in that field.
Orcs ride wolves and sometimes boars, and even spiders, as far as one can trust the rumour mill.
The city is the centre of the known world. It is almost as if everything else is just built around it!
Perhaps one day we will expand to Carlin. The women there will just love our ponies!
I heard the elves ride every animal that roams the woods. From wolves and bears to squirrels, the elves befriend and ride them all. Just amazing!
As far as I know, the goblins ride all kinds of creepy things like lizards, centipedes, spiders and slugs. Most of those beasts can even walk on the ceilings of caverns and climb walls with ease!
If we could convince the king to use one of our coaches on his next visit to Venore, our business would get a fundamental boost!
We loan mounts for a certain time. Those horses are easy to handle and loyal.
Be careful, the straw is highly inflammable.

We order our coaches from the dwarfs. They deliver high quality work that rarely breaks. Therefore we rarely have any delays. That is if there are no bandits, or monsters, or bad weather, or the horses are on the loose and such.
Good bye!
Welcome Player! Rarely I can welcome visitors in these days.
My name is Oldrak.
I guard this humble temple as a monument for the order of the nightmare knights.
A weapon of myth and legend. It was lost in ancient times ... perhaps lost forever.
That's where we are. The world of Tibia.
Now, it is 00:00 am.
Beware the foul undead!
They created Tibia and all life on it ... and unlife, too.
This ancient order was created by a circle of wise humans who were called 'the dreamers'. The order became extinct a long time ago.
Many perished in their battles against evil, some went mad, not able to stand their nightmares any longer. Others were seduced by the darkness.
They learned the ancient art of dreamwalking from some elves they befriended.
While the dreamwalkers of the elves experienced the brightest dreams of pleasure, the humans strangely had dreams of dark omen.
They dreamed of doom, destruction, talked to dead, tormented souls, and gained unwanted insight into the schemes of darkness.
The greatest necromant who ever cursed our land with the steps of his feet. He was defeated by the nightmare knights.
It is rumoured to open the entrance to the pits of inferno, also called the nightmare pits. Even if I knew about this secret I wouldn't tell you.
The Ruthless Seven - Banor help me - have their domain deep under the Plains of Havoc. I don't even dare to speak out their names.
Ah, the bane of the Plains of Havoc, the hidden beast, the unbeatable foe. I live here for years and I am sure it's only a myth.

There are many tales about the fearsome Hugo. It's said it is an abomination, accidentally created by Yenny the Gentle. It's halve demon, halve something else and people say it's still alive after dozens of years.
Yenny, known as the Gentle, was one of most powerful magic wielders in ancient times and known throughout the world for her mercy and kindness.
Good bye, Player!
Be greeted, dear traveller Player.
I am just a humble monk and responsible to maintain this little outpost that is leftover from our grand order.

Our order was once the greatest and richest in the whole known world. Kings, traders and knights of various orders were our supporters and the gods smiled upon us ... or at least that's what we thought until the day of doom.
On the day of doom, our dream of building the greatest and most opulent cathedral was shattered.
What was once planned as the most impressive cathedral of all times, lies now in ruins. ...
All that the earthquake has left over is a heap of rubble. The ruins are cursed and everybody who dares to go there will draw the ire of heaven on himself. ...
All those that travel there are infested with bad luck. But only few have returned from this treacherous ground. Noxious fumes are killing intruders almost unnoticed. ...
Crumbling structures might kill you instantly. ...
Those who survive the dangers of nature will face the soul-eating ghosts of those who have died in the catastrophe. ...
It's not worth to go there, there are no richnesses or treasures left in the ruins, the gold of our order melted away in funding the cathedral's construction. ...
I urge you to stay away from the cursed ground and the ruins. For the safety of your body and your soul keep away from there.
Some say it was just the unstable ground or volcanic activity, some even claim it was the work of demons, but we know it was the will of the gods to punish our vanity.
In our vanity we thought that we could impress the gods with our money and show piety by building them a monument. ...
We were wrong and the gods punished us by sending the worst earthquake that mankind has seen. ...
Its ground motions could still be felt in Thais and as the dust settled, little had remained of that what we had built. ...
Most members of our order were dead, others turned mad or lost faith. We are all that is left from our glorious order.
I am not worthy to speak about the gods.

We monks of the humble path feel that we are not worthy to spread the word of the gods. We live in humility and poverty to serve the gods. Most of us have vowed an oath of silence and I humbly took the burden to become the spokesperson.
I know nothing about that topic. If you would excuse me, I have things to attend. (deixa de conversa)
The king is a worldly ruler, and we don't burden ourselves with worldly concerns anymore.
He will discover where his path will lead him to. But no matter how ruthless he is, even he stays away from the ruins of the cathedral.
It is rumoured to be hidden somewhere beneath Edron.
I own no watch and only a small number of other worldly possessions.
The gracious tradesmen from Venore send us provisions from time to time.
Thais is far and we have little contact with the kingdom's capital.
I hope the knightly order there fares better than our own.
We have no relations with that town.
They will have to learn on their own.
The dwarves are far from being humble. At least this ancient folk knows that there is nothing to gain in the cathedral's ruins and their treasure hunters stay away from there.
I will not judge those people.
I am not the right person to discuss this subject.
Accept my sincere good wishes, Player.
Hi Player. Come in and have a drink.
I can offer you beer and wine. Ask me for a trade.
Of course, just browse through my wares.
Well, I'm the boss of this tavern.
I'm Snake Eye.
He is a wild warrior. Nobody knows his real name. We just call him H.L. You can find him in the small armory shop.
He's the worst. The so called god of the dwarves. I don't believe it. It's all crap.
Never heard of him.
Never heard of him.
Never heard of him.
Cip sux!
Well, I had a dispute with a snake once. And the snake won. Bit my left eye out. Therefore, Snake Eye.
It's a great tavern. No closing time. No problems with kings or other rulers. Best place in Tibia.
Yeah. I'm the boss. So don't bother me.
There's already too much order in Tibia. We don't need kings or whatever.
We don't need one.
Go and get a watch.
Believe me! There are no gods.
The Gods of Tibia! What a crap! It's all superstition!
Crap. Crap! CRAP! It's all CRAP!
In the beginning, it was a nice encampment. Now it's an overcrowded, polluted city. I hate it!
I've never been there. Don't know anything about it.
Kazordoon is alright. Except for the dwarves. I don't like them. But the mountains are a good place. Been there once.
That's a place for wealthy toffs!
I've never been there. I don't like the elves anyway.
There are a lot of wild warriors around. They built this camp.
Well, the real wild warriors don't live here. They hide in the woods.
Well. I know of a small camp to the south.
It's abandoned. But I bet that something is hidden there!
Go and find out yourself. You can tell me if you find something.
It's the best place to live. By the way, there's an old wild warrior building to the southwest. It might be interesting for you.
Go and ask H.L. about it.
It's abandoned. But I bet that something is hidden there!

conversation.prompt: buy / sell / stuff / ware / goods / equipment / helmet / armor / shield / legs / weapon / trousers
answer: I sell food and drinks. Ask me for a trade if you want.
I have fish, meat, and bread. Ask me for a trade if you want any.
Yep, I have some left. Ask me for a trade.
Oh come on kid, you don't know what you're talking about.
I've done my part in this business. Go away.
Bye.
Hmmm. I buy weapons, armor, and other stuff. What do you want, Player?
Elves... I hate them.
Forget the gods
Women are not good for fighting. I don't need them. I don't trade with them. And I don't like them.
Well Snake Eye isn't 'my' boss if you mean that.
Hmmm. Let me think. I guess you need something big. And steel-reinforced. A barrel, maybe.
You mean our old building in the south-west?
Ah, nevermind.
That's the old hideout. Quite an interesting place down there. There are lots of security mechanics and traps. But it collapsed partly.
Yes. That's why we... well, they planned a new hideout. Our old hideout was the original vault.
There might be still some good stuff in there, I guess.
You mean inside that vault? Uhm. I don't know what stuff there is. Sorry.
I don't have anything to offer, but I buy almost everything. Wanna trade?
I buy weapons, distance weapons, armors and shields. If you want to see only a certain category, tell me which of those.
Ha! Thais. I lived there once. You know, I was in the royal army. But what they're fighting for... it's all wrong. I deserted.
You get an excellent fighter training in the army. But they are fighting for the wrong cause.
I don't really want to talk about it.
Forget about Cip.
Wild warriors always have something to hide.
What key? Show me!
Oh. That's a new key. Hmmm. Must be for the new hideout.
Yes. Those doors seem to be driven by some strange... devices. But I have no idea how they work. Maybe you can find something out?
Yeah. I'm a wild warrior. Well, to be honest, I was. I left them. Some of them became too aggressive. Simply attacking everyone for no reason is not good.
Dwarfs are good people. I like them.
Forget Durin. He's the worst anyway.
Forget Steve.
Forget Guido.
Forget Stephan.
Might be a good place to live. But the people are too Thais friendly for my taste
That's me.
They should hang him...
I buy all kinds of armory and weapons.
Well, at least there's one place worth visiting in Tibia. Here!
Won't tell you.
It's somewhere in the woods, of course. I don't know where.
Most people in the camp are just hunters.
Tibia doesn't need a ruler.
He the boss of that tavern. He's alright.
About what? I have no time for this, now move along.
Didn't I already tell you to go? If you don't have anything important to say, leave me alone.
Be careful out there.
You can drink and eat there. Everything you want in a tavern.
These woods are a good place to hide.
Bye.

Hunter's greeting! I assume you want something from me since you came all the way out here on your own. This is a dangerous place to be, I doubt that all my men will accept strangers like I do. You don't seem to have any problems with that, though.
My name is Rottin Wood, I'm the leader of this bunch - but hey, everyone knows that, right? Right.
We are hunters. We are chasing our prey in the woods, ever watchful, ever deadly, evergreen.

Aaaaah the thrill of the hunt. The wind in the forest making the trees talk to you. The glistening water of the rivers and lakes... you cannot get enough of it, can you? OUCH! Fir cone... again... I hate this... ah, nevermind.
Isn't it a beautiful world? Just look at this forest, aaah.
Well, he never tells anyone his real name. He always wears his old wedding ring, though. It has a small engraving, the letters 'H.' and 'L.'. So we simply call him H.L.
Yes, we were all married once. In fact we still are. That's why we're here. ...

We are selling lucky charms. Actually each lucky charm is an ordinary rabbit's foot - with a special handcrafted ribbon of course, heh. Made by the guys, heh. The people in Thais are going crazy for those.
I don't like the city. I sleep among trees out in the open.
Carlin? Never been there.
Been there once, but that was a long time ago.
I'm the king of the forest.
I command my own... army. And I'm proud to say that we are the... the strongest - hey, hey you there, are you taking a nap?! You're on sentry duty! Quit fooling around and start your shift!
Judging by the position of the sun, the wind in the trees, the slightly glistening dew on the moss and my watch - it is about 2:38 am.
What? That old legend? If you want legends, you should join us - unfortunately it isn't possible for you to join us. In fact, no one can, heh.
Yeah, well. I'm the king of the forest - what about that, eh?
Hey there, well no new missions from Rottin Wood and his men today - but you can still help us with some tasks.
Some random fool came here and started getting on everyone's nerves. Oh wait, you're HERE. Hmph.
Alright of course. You can help us getting even more lucky charms. There are also some repairs to be made around the camp. For now these are the only tasks we can offer.

Are you ready to get more lucky charms? You know, if we won't get our hands on new charms in time, we will surely have to starve... during the autumn. That would be a hard time for all of us. So... you in once again?
Welcome back, did you repair all the broken structures?
If you don't want to do this - I have no problem with that. But my comrades... well if they are getting a cold, have fun getting out of the woods in one piece.

Are you ready to get more lucky charms? You know, if we won't get our hands on new charms in time, we will surely have to starve... during the autumn. That would be a hard time for all of us. So... you in once again?

Hey, I like rabbits too, alright? And I doubt anyone would even notice if you would just take a wooden spoon and put some wool on it with the ribbon. But the people want it - and we need the money. So, no pain, no gain, my friend.
Not possible. You cannot - in fact no one can - join us. Not anymore. ...
The gods must be praised that I am finally saved.
I'm a priestess and I travelled here to learn about that order of the humble path I heard about. ...
But when I started my investigations, this false monk Lorbas thought that I was suspicious and so he ordered his minions to take me as prisoner.
There are no records about the foundation of this order, and it is unknown where its 'monks' come from. Yet, travellers told us that they are living near the remains of the dark cathedral.
I learnt that these monks are impostors that use false promises to lure unwary ones into the arms of their strange cult which seems to have more political than religious agendas.

I think Lorbas liked the idea to 'convert' me to their twisted cult and saw it as a test for their leaders. Now that the magic symbols are turned off, I will gather my strength within some hours and teleport to safety.
The cathedral was meant to be a centre of piety and believe. A prayer to the gods that had become solid. ...
The construction works started at the height of the order of the Nightmare Knights, right after they had won a major battle near the place where the cathedral was to be built. ...
The cathedral was meant to become a monument of the victory of good over evil. ...
Sadly it was just not meant to be. ...
As the cathedral was nearly finished, most of the monks had already moved in and even a small town for all the workers and suppliers had established itself. ...
But then the structure was struck by an earthquake and the work of two generations was destroyed. ...
Later the dwarven constructors explained that this was caused by volcanic activities and a massive cave-in. ...
Since the gods did not interfere and the setting was close to the notorious Pits of Inferno, it was assumed that this was the work of secret demonic powers.
The cult is secretly looking for the unsatisfied, disgruntled and poor. Its members promise such sad individuals wealth, revenge and a cause. ...
They lure them into the cells of their cult. Here they learn how to undermine the authorities of their cities. They are trained as thieves, spies and smugglers first. ...

Those who prove themselves as the most promising candidates are recruited to a special hidden circle. There they learn the dark arts of poisoning and murder, or elocution and agitation to become assassins and recruiters for the cult. ...
I know nothing about their agenda but I am quite sure there has to be some higher power behind all of this.
I've no idea who is the mastermind behind all this, but it seems too big and too well organised to be the work of only a handful of false monks.
I'd love to discuss the teachings of the gods with you but this is neither the time nor the place.
The dwarves carry bitterness and pain in their souls. But it is them that have forgotten about the gods and not the other way around.
The elves have lost their balance and identity. In this unstable state they can easily be misled or might draw the wrong conclusions.
We all have to help to make this world a better place.
I'm still gathering my strength for a teleport home, but some power already has returned. Do you wish to be teleported out of this cell?
So be it!
As you wish.
Sadly the trade barons care more about wealth than the gods.
The druids have their own way to interpret the gods' will and this has to be respected.
Many see Thais as a fallen city but it is only the loudness of an ugly minority that gives people this impression.
The downfall of some of the most noble knights there should serve us as a warning to stay on guard for the evil that wants to lure us on the wrong path.
A far away continent that will widen our view of the wonders the gods provide us with.
I know only little about the teachings of Daraman but as far as I heard they concentrate too much on the single individual instead on the world as a whole.
This city is the best example where godless philosophies might lead to.
The assassins are the eyes and the long arm of this damnable cult. They eliminate the enemies and those who found out too much about their plans. Be aware of that and always watch your back.
The dark monks are the teachers and seducers of this cult. They work covertly in the cities and train thieves and assassins in the underground base here.
One day this weapon will be unearthed and then it will be wielded against the servants of the evil.
He is only one of the many servants of the evil. Eventually he will fall but there will be others to take his place.
The king is a wise ruler but his realm is large and we all need to work hard to make the world a better place.
Did you talk to my friend Lynda in Thais already? Greet her from me. She will be glad to hear about my safety.
May the gods bless you.
Hi there! Welcome to the spike.
I'm the operating commander of the Spike, the latest great accomplishment of the gnomish race. ...
The Spike is a crystal structure, created by our greatest crystal experts. It has grown from a crystal the size of my fist to the structure you see here and now. ...
Of course this did not happen from one day to the other. It's the fruit of the work of several gnomish generations. Its purpose has changed in the course of time. ...
At first it was conceived as a fast growing resource node. Then it was planned to become the prototype of a new type of high security base. ...
Now it has become a military base and a weapon. With our foes occupied elsewhere, we can prepare our strike into the depths of the earth. ...
This crystal can withstand extreme pressure and temperature, and it's growing deeper and deeper even as we speak. ...

The times of the fastest growth have come to an end, however, and we have to slow down in order not to risk the structural integrity of the Spike. But we are on our way and have to do everything possible to defend the Spike.
I'm responsible for the security and reward heroes to our cause. If you are looking for missions, talk to Gnomilly, Gnombold and Gnomagery.
I can sell special outfit parts. If your fame is high enough, you might be worthy of such a reward.
You can acquire the basic outfit for 1000 gold, the first addon for 2000 gold and the second addon for 3000 gold. Which do you want to buy?
I'm Gnommander, the commander of this structure that we call the spike.
I'm the operating commander of the Spike, the latest great accomplishment of the gnomish race.

The dwarfs have been good trading partners, but in our war we stand more or less without their support. The dwarfs have troubles of their own it seems, and I doubt their support would have been anything significant.

After centuries of hiding and evasion, we are now striking back at our enemies. Only time will tell if this was a smart decision; but now that we have chosen this path, we gnomes will make the best of it.
Well, it's 1:00 am.
I have only heard about it now and then. Seems like it's only some metal sword and probably too big and unhandy.
Though the human realms are not really supportive to our cause, luckily you humans are so numerous that we still have some volunteers like you to support us.
Stone has proven himself a competent man and earned gnomish respect. We need more men like him. He gives us hope that we might find some worthy allies in your kin.
It's hard to fight an enemy that never shows its face. It's like fighting shadows; and every victory feels somewhat hollow.

The Spike is made of the hardest crystal known to gnomekind. Yet like each crystal, it has it weaknesses. We can't allow our enemies to disrupt its integrity. The deeper we've dug, the more angers and enemies we faced. ...
Some threats are minor, some are major. But even the smallest threat might endanger the Spike's existence, given enough time and enough leverage. Therefore, we have to fight a war on many fronts. ...
Aside from constant threats, there are purposeful attacks on the Spike. Every now and then, the creatures of the depths gather in great numbers in order to launch destructive attacks. ...
These are times for heroes I guess. People who make a stand against the tides of enemies.
The Spike is still growing into the depths. The speed has almost come to a halt to the untrained eye, but we make slow yet steady progress. ...
Now it's important to concentrate on the defence of the Spike since the dangers that threaten not only its growth, but also its existence, are numerous indeed.

With our limited supply, we have to use every resource as efficiently as possible. In your case this means we have to put you to use according to your abilities. It would be a waste of your skills to let you do something trivial. ...

On the other hand, it would be an even greater waste to get you killed by something you could never hope to handle. Our officers will see to it that you are assigned to the areas that suit you best. ...
Be aware though that we are a separate division from gnomebase Alpha. You will have to earn our respect here by the tasks you did for us and the Spike alone.
Good bye Player and take care.
Hi!
I'm the officer responsible for this area. I give out missions, accept mission reports and oversee our defences.
On these levels we found evidence of some monumental battle that has taken place here centuries ago. We also found some grave sites, but oddly enough no clues of any form of settlement. ...
Some evidence we have found suggests that at least one of the battles here was fought for many, many years. People came here, lived here, fought here and died here. ...
The battles continued until someone or something literally ploughed through the battlefields, turning everything upside down. All this killing and death soaked the area with negative energy. ...
Necromantic forces are running wild all over the place and we are hard-pressed to drive all these undead, spirits and ghosts, away from the Spike. ...
Unless we can secure that area somehow, the Spike operation is threatened to become crippled by the constant attacks of the undead. ...

The whole growing downwards could come to a halt, leaving us exposed to even more attacks, counter attacks, and giving the enemy time to prepare their defences. There's a lot to do for aspiring adventurers.
Sorry, but no! Your expertise could be put to better use elsewhere. Here awaits you no challenge. You are desperately needed in the deeper levels of the Spike. Report there immediately.
What mission do you want to report about: recharging the ghost pacifiers, the release of the spiritual anger, about tracking an evil presence and the killing of demon skeletons?
We are the only protectors of the world against the enemies below. With small stature comes great responsibilities, as they say.

Dwarfs are our eldest allies, but to be honest we learned little of each other's ways. Dwarfs and gnomes were content to share just enough goods and knowledge to have some profits and else be left alone.
I still wonder how we should feed all of you. You are so many and absurdly huge!
They are an enigma. They are cunning and powerful, and this hints at a small stature. Then again they are ruthless and evil, which hints at a large stature.
The good old gnomebase has served us quite well. Usually, we have bases only temporarily, and are constantly on the move; but some of the bases endure. ...
Gnomebase Alpha is one of them and we are quite proud of it.
It's time for us gnomes to strike back at our enemies. The Spike will help us accomplish that.
Good bye Player and take care.
Welcome adventurer! I'm sensing some very unusual distortions in the fabric of reality recently. They are caused by an inactive portal right beside me. ...

I found a way to activate it. Yet, to keep it open, I have to stay here, focusing on the portal. Thus I need you to go in there and uncover the true story behind those distortions. Can I count on you?

Thank you very much. In order to pass the invisible portal over there, you have to visit three places that are closely linked to death and afterlife. Sound this knell at each of the sites to infuse your aura with the ghostly energies there. ...
The places you have to visit are: the cemetery east of Carlin, a sacrificial site beneath the Ghostlands and a skull-adorned altar underneath the Dark Cathedral. ...

You also have to drink a special potion to pass the portal. Find bone meal and grave flower extract and mix them together to brew this potion. Once you drank the potion you will be able to pass the portal.

It is the world of the dead. Many sages believe, that it is located below the world of the living. Yet some think, it lies within another dimension so that terms like above or beneath are inappropriate to describe it. ...
There are some rumours that the descent to the Netherworld is difficult yet possible for those still living.
I guess, it should be made from a skull. Yes, grinding a skull into fine dust will do.
As the name implies, grave flowers grow on graves. Pick one and distil it to extract its essence.
It is right beside me. I have found it by using my magic devices.
Hello. How are you? Maybe you can help me: Do my shoes have the same colour?
My name is Nemal.
I have no job. I'm a wanderer.
I had a watch. It was nice, but I can't see the hands anymore.
I don't sell things. If you really need somthing, better walk straight to one of the towns or ask another adventurer.
Yes, I used to live there a while ago. Nice town.
Aaaahh, Carlin, yes. I know this town. Strange graveyard there, isn't it?
Desert? Where is one?
King...king...yes, there is one. I still can remember the time when we had an other king. What was his name again?
I can't read or write. What use would I have of a library?
I can't read. I've never learned it.
Closed doors need keys. What a pity keys are not lying around like rubbish!
Secrets should remain secret. No need of making them public.
You can find some treasures here - some are bigger, some are smaller, some are of true value, some are of materialistic value.
There are many ways. I don't know all of them.
I don't believe in gods, but a lot of people do. I never saw a god, why should I trust in someone I never met?
Better know how to fight!
I always have weapons with me. You never know what's behind the next corner.
I have a sword. It's very sharp. But I don't give it away, you never know.
Hmmm.. I wouldn't ever join a guild, but i know of the existance of some.
I heard the name, but I don't trust rumours.
My father knew this language.
Yes, I seem to be blind. But I am not sure - maybe the dungeons are too dark!
I heard of a potion of regained vision ... but I can't remember how to make it! Maybe you can help me. Do you know something about it?
So, did you bring the ingredients with you, stranger?
Oh. Maybe someone else could do it, then.
It doesn't seem to me as if you have the correct ingredients with you, stranger!
You seem to have them with you. Can you tell me, how many minutes I have to cook them?

Silvertides is our city, home of the coast folk. At the beginning of the period we call 'the Rising', we still made great efforts to push the water back and keep it away from the island. ...
In the meantime, however, we have accepted that the water and the land coalesce more and more. We regard it as a part of our lives and even a part of ourselves.
It began centuries ago but it progresses very slowly. We, the coast folk here in Silvertides, have strongly integrated the Rising into our culture and way of life. ...

They descended from the sky and surrounded the fallen moon. Here, in these mountains, they began a magical dance. And lo and behold, Amati was healed and, with the help of the stars, was able to rise into the sky again. ...

First rule: every kill is justified in the arena. Otherwise, the PvP rules of your world will apply to the arena on your world. ...
As for the rest of the rules, the most important thing to know is that there is a time limit for each fight as well as right before a match. ...
After the fight has been initiated by giving me the necessary details, a timer will be started. ...
A fight is won if either only one player is left or only one team (at least one member of the team still standing at the end of a fight). ...
The fight will be canceled if the predetermined number of players for a fight does not show up in the anteroom. ...
If a fight is in progress but takes too long or no clear winner could be termined (this includes team fights were at least one member of both teams is still standing), it will be canceled as well.
Every premium player can participate in the arena. To initiate the arena, just talk to me and tell me if you want to play last man standing or a team deathmatch. ...
If the arena is not currently occupied you will then be able to tell me how many players will take part. You can also create one-on-one matches in both modes by adding only 2 players. ...
If you opted for a team deathmatch, you will have to select the members for each team by telling me the correct names. ...
After that you will have to specify the stakes for the fight.
I can give you information on stakes or how the prize money will be split in last man standing or team deathmatch mode.
Depending on the stake the initiating player has determined for a fight, each player will have to have this amount of gold on his or her bank account to take part. ...
As soon as the match starts (not while waiting or by entering an anteroom after the fight has been initiated), the money will be deducted. ...
Together, these stakes will add to the prize money, which will either go to the single winner of a last man standing fight or to the winning team in a team deathmatch. ...
If the match cannot be finished within the time limit, this money will be lost!
In a last man standing fight, the prize money which consists of all stakes of each player together, will go to the last player standing. ...
In a team deathmatch this money is split evenly among each player of the winning team (please note that the final share will be rounded down in case of uneven splits). ...
If a winning team consists of 5 players and only 2 members are still standing at the end of a fight, the money will still be split among all 5 members of the team.

To explain the infinity of parallel dimensions, please imagine the following. ...
We are currently at a specific point in the flow of time. Let's call it point ZERO at 12:00 o'clock. ...
As time flows I might drop my pencil to the ground - so the flow of time and the events chained to it have gone in direction ONE which leads to 12:01 o'clock with a dropped pencil. ...

Now let's go back to point ZERO. I might also have just put it back into my pocket - the flow of time and its chain of events would have taken a 'different' direction, direction TWO - which leads to a 12:01 o'clock where I never dropped my pencil. ...

Now imagine that 'both' directions actually exist - but you are only aware of one chain of events that has happened. The one where I dropped the pencil. And this is 'your' dimension, the one you are bound to. ...
One 'parallel' dimension would be where the chain of events went in direction TWO. The pencil has been put into my pocket. ...

Now imagine that there is an endless amount of ZERO points, maybe at 12:00 o'clock and one second, or at 12:00 o'clock and two seconds - each from which time can take any possible and probably impossible direction. ...

And whatever direction a chain of events takes, there will always be an infinite amount of points in time from which new events can take completely different directions, creating completely different dimensions of time. ...
Now you might have a better picture of the infinity of dimensions.

My name is Sinclair. Pleased to meet you. Now where was I - oh yes.

I'm a scientist in the field of ecto-magical research and development. But curses are not my subject. Talk to Thomas, he might know something.
My colleague and fellow campaigner in our quest to explore the world of the spirits. He was the first one I encountered actively interested in this field of science
We can work quite untroubled here in the university - at least for now.
Thais is a lively city, that's for sure. Well, I'm not much a people person actually, so... maybe you should ask someone else about that.

In contrary to ghasts, ghosts are dangerous phenomena that can change their position, they wail and can even manipulate materia in the case of 'poltergeists'. ...

It is also possible to communicate with some of them, but be wary of their true evil nature and keep your distance. You may even encounter harmless ghosts out there. But those are very rare and usually tied to sad events.
Ghasts largely differ from ghosts in a way that they are almost always stationary, silent manifestations of a dead person or creature. They are also a common illusion poorly talented mages think of.
Apparitions can be visions - very similar to day-dreams - of spirits or ghostly phenomena. ...
Those visions always feel very real, we tracked several cases where people were actually... 'eaten' by one of those. You should take them very seriously.

Spirits can be good and also evil. In common belief, spirits are often seen as guides or guardians of people. But there are many forms and types of them, and they often actively try to cause harm. ...
We also use 'spirit' as a broader term to describe all sorts of ghosts, ghasts and apparitions here at the Spirithunters headquarters.
That's currently Spectulus, me and - well, you of course!

What? Well, let me see - it is 5:12 am. Satisfied?

Well, we are indeed not far from a major breakthrough in the field of ecto-magical disturbances.

There was a greedy man from Edron who wanted to find a very rare gem. Based on a loose story told by a travelling merchant, he found the mountain where the gem had to be ripped from the clutches of the stone. ...
He searched so hard and with so much effort that he became obsessed by not only the stone but the search itself. He turned every stone, spent all his money and crew and equipment. ...
His obsessiveness would eventually cost him the only precious thing still left to him, his own life. ...
His obsession became so powerful, however, that it is said he roams the small mountain to this very day. The hidden stone still his object of desire. ...
If this is indeed true, we have an object or relic here - the stone itself - which could be used for our paranormal studies.
Goodbye and good luck Player.
Hello, brave fighter! What can I do for you? Do you want information, to trade drome points, talk about the old days or take a look at our famous Phants?
Name's Emilio!
I specialised in trading potions in exchange for arena badges. I always liked that job, watching the fights from time to time, helping younger heroes with their first fights. ...
So I kept it. Actually my whole family earned their living this way, you can still meet my brothers and sisters by visiting the other arenas. ...
Maybe you'll even get to know my whole family someday!
We keep a register of every fighter that comes through. If you want to know your personal drome level, starting level or drome points you came to the right place! ...
If you want to know how all this works I have to ask you to refer to the sign over there. I just don't have the time to answer these questions.
In the old arena, if you finished all 10 waves of an arena battle, you'd obtain a fixed amount of arena badges. ...
The exact amount depended on the selected difficulty level. ...
I can check the total amount and offer you potions in exchange for them. Do you want me to hand out your arena badges now?
As a special service for our most valued customers, we used to hand out a surprise cube. By using it, you'd have a chance of getting nice little goodies.
Well, I guess you'd like to know what I'm still doing here.

It's quite easy. I give you arena badges for each arena battle you completed in the past. Surviving 10 waves against monsters in the arena granted you a fixed amount of badges depending on the difficulty level. ...
You can keep the arena badges or exchange them for each kind of health, mana and spirit potions. I'll charge 1 arena badge for the amount of 100 mana or health potions. ...

Emilio: 100 strong potions of either mana or health will be charged with 2, 100 great health potions with 4 and 100 great mana potions with 3, 100 ultimate potions of either type with 7 and 100 supreme potions with 10 arena badges. ....
You can also select 100 great spirit potions for 4 and 100 ultimate spirit potions for 8 arena badges. ...
Would you like to exchange for health, mana or spirit potions now?
There were 5 difficulty levels when fighting against waves of monsters in the old arena. Each difficulty level granted you a certain amount of arena badges. ...
Level 1 granted one badge, level 2 granted two, level 3 granted three, level 4 granted four and level 5 granted seven arena badges.
Take care and come back soon!
At your service Player and welcome to the post office.
I'm responsible for this post office. Just ask for our offers.
My name is Chrystal.
Our post system spans the entire known world.

Our post system even delivers letters and parcels to and from this isle.
Hail to the king!
The army ensures the safety of the traderoutes and of our mail system.

Mr. Postner is the leader of our guild and the most prominent postofficer in the whole land.

It is horas right now.
Who is next?
Welcome, Player. If you're interested in spells to support your party, I can be your teacher.
I have 'Train Party' for Knights, 'Protect Party' for Paladins, 'Heal Party' for Druids and 'Enchant Party' for Sorcerers. You can only use these spells if you are in a party with others.
I'm a teacher for party spells. That's party spells as in 'support your party members', and not 'how to get people to love your birthday party'. Just to be clear.
My name is Eliza.
I have no idea, I'm sorry. You could ask Fiona or Zoltan, though.
Having a party is a good thing. You can kill much stronger monsters than when you're on your own.
Talented magicians gather in these towers and work together in researching spells. That's why the most powerful spells are only taught in Edron.
I've only been to Thais once or twice. I prefer a quieter place to live and study.
I don't like the attitude of the women there. They are all a little trigger-happy, if you know what I mean.
The king is a quite impressive man. Even though his deeds are often criticised, I'm sure that he only wants the best for Tibia.
People call me pessimistic, but I think this world will go down the drain sooner or later.
Well, the new spells we recently discovered could prove to be quite valuable. Time will tell.
It's 6:51 pm.
Goodbye, Player.
Greetings to you, weary traveller! Do you want something to eat or drink?
My name is of no importance, traveller.
I'm a tavern keeper. I own a tavern. You are standing in it right now. So do you want something to eat, drink or what?
Well, here you go then.
To your health!
It's a fine refuge, don't you think? You can eat, drink and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere to your heart's content!
There are crystals manifold in the hall of refulgence. Yet the eye, the eye of the chasm is the most important - the one important thing. Worth... to me... and me alone, more than anything.
The eye of the chasm. It is the one thing worth anything in this world. It's... it... what do you know about it? No, you don't know anything about the eye! Hmpf!
The king? Er, yes. Our good king. Xenom... he is - oh, I mean he was - a... proud and just ruler. No? Oh, you mean Ti... Tibianus? Of course... yes, very well then.
Don't be... no good can ever come of it.
Edron? Oh this place. Yes, it is a very fine... location. I myself am from Thais, you know. A big metropolis. But it was too busy, too loud. I much prefer the countryside.
Farewell, traveller!
Off you go then!
Oh, hello. You might be one of the talented adventurers we are looking for!
I'm Gnomcruiter.
I'm a recruiter of the gnomish expedition corps.
It's 10:06 pm.
I doubt anything exciting can happen above ground.
It's a very primal area, teeming with life and some of it might even not try to eat you. At some point of the very distant past there must have been a thriving civilisation. ...
Given the fact that many of the local creatures seem to be the forefathers of creatures that we know, we might unearth a connection to known civilisations. ...
Not to mention the abundance of natural resources that we can gather in the area.
I'm looking for talented people to assist our expedition corps.
Are you interested in joining the efforts of the gnomish expedition corps?
You are probably too big anyway.
So listen, our prospectors recently discovered a marvelous new place deep under the surface of the world ...
It is a whole landmass illuminated by a strange mist that hangs over it. ...
It's populated by all kinds of primordeal creatures. ...
Some are probably the progenitors of creatures that we currently know, whereas other creatures have never been seen before. ...
In a joint venture with the adventurers guild we try to unearth the area's treasures and even discovered the remains of a mysterious civilisation that has become extinct long ago. ...
Our greatest accomplishment yet was the discovery of the so called exaltation forge. ...
Our gnomish scientists made the thing work and the adventurers' guild transported it to one of their bases. ...
And we can only guess what other discoveries await us. ...
As of now though, our operation has run into problems. That's where you come into play. ...
We are looking for experienced people that want to join our efforts.
Wait, now I recognize you. You already joined the expedition. Oh my, did you hit your head on a stalactite, lately? Oh, nevermind.
Great! Consider yourself conscripted. ...
So get to the steamboat on that isle ... I guess you call it Cormaya, and ask for a passage to Gnomprona. ...
Talk to Gnominer, the leader of our operations in Gnomprona. He will tell you where your help is needed most.
Take care.
Greetings, adventurer!
Well, the whole place here is an anomaly so to say. You can hardly have missed the fact that you arrived here through a mystical gate. ...
Well, actually it's no gate at all but a rift in the fabric of nature. It is this minor plane trying to reconnect to our world.

This is a lesser plane of tarnished, elemental fire that once belonged to the world that we know. It was despoiled in the wars of the gods and broke loose from our world. Lost and drifting through the void, without a connection to our plane.
Well, that was how it used to be. Lost and without any connection to our world. But that was before things ... changed.
Something is tearing at the fabric of reality. I can't tell what is it but the boundaries between worlds are fading. ...
A process that was watched for over a century, but which has extremely grown in momentum over the last few years. Something is happening and it's certainly nothing good. ...
Be it as it may, the plane trying to reconnect was only a side effect. It still might teach us about what is happening and it has attracted some attention already.
We know about other planes of existence but in all history it has never been as easy to reach them as it is now. ...
Sometimes world seem to overlap and we can identify more and more such planes and worlds. More than we ever had imagined. All we can tell is, that something is changing. And not for the good.
Such an anomaly couldn't go unnoticed for long. This led to the presence of unwanted intruders, and other entities were dragged into it by the nature of the sphere.
Infernalists were the first who found their way into this sphere. Hoping to tap its rotten power somehow. Yet this sphere created creatures of its own and drew others here from other planes.
This place became a fiery trap to certain beings with an affinity to fire. Somehow it reconnects randomly with the known world, to which it once belonged ...
But also to other places that it shares some affinity with, like hellish places of unspeakable evil that spawn infernal creatures.
I'm a researcher of the scientific council of the mage guild and I came to that place to study this anomaly.
I'm professor Falonzo from the mage guild.
Good bye!
Feel welcome in my humble hut, Player. If you are heavily wounded or poisoned, I can heal you.
My Name is Albert Fibulanian.
I'm a healer.
The sinful city of Thais is a monument of corruption and murder. I'm glad I left for Edron and thank the gods every day for this isle.
Now, it is 6:30 am.
I've only got news about weather, taxes, and harvests. I heard nothing that would interest a traveller like you.
I'm gifted with the ability to heal the wounded and sick ones. Yet, there are wounds of the soul that even the most powerful magic can't cure.
You aren't looking really bad. Sorry, I can't help you.
Tibia is a world big enough for everyone. I wish people would realise that.

My family used to live on the isle of Fibula. At this time it wasn't overrun by soldiers of fortune. Later, I was sent to Thais to learn the art of healing, while my family was amongst the first settlers of Edron.
I healed his wounds, but nothing can heal his soul after the betrayal of some of his knightly brethren.
Oh better ask the knights about that issue. I know only little about that tragic story. Some knights betrayed their order and joined some sinister cult in the northern ruins.
Another victim of his own ambitions. I mourn for his soul.
The gods of good take care of us.
I mourn the fallen god as I mourn all sinners who have lost their path and live their lives in darkness.
The king does much to enhance the life of his people, but he could do more.
I dream of times which see no need for armies or warriors.
I praise the brave heroes that risk their lives to defy that unholy beast! Even if the creature is not always defeated, their efforts did stop him from invading the town.
The fallen one is a perfect example where evil leads us to.
It's only another instrument of pain and destruction.
Good bye, Player!
Oh dear, I can't find anything in here!

Jane!
JAAAAACK? EVERYTHING ALRIGHT DOWN THERE?
I demand an explanation of you entering our house without any invitation.
I'm the mother of Jack and Jane.
I do the cooking and some other housework. Jack's sister Jane is helping me a lot, though.
It's exactly 6:47 am.
I'm sorry but I do not have any news for you.
JAAACK!! Why won't he come up here? Jack!! No, no I can't believe it.
Well, Jane is of course helping me with the household, always doing this and that. Hardworking girl she is, hardworking girl.
I'm happy right here as long as Jack and Jane are with me.
I have lived here as long as I can remember. And the same goes for Jack and his sister Jane.
I don't even know where that is.
Now you start asking the same things like Jack's sister, what's all the fuss about visiting the king anyway.
I would never allow Jack to go away from here, he stays with us.

James.

If I were you, I would stay here.
I was born in Thais, but my family moved to Edron among the first settlers.
I never saw him in person.
May Crunor bless our harvests.
A brave warrior as far as a farmer like me can tell.
He scares me a little.
The mages and druids have quite an appetite. They buy much from me and summon even more food.
I am nothing but a humble farmer and know nothing about that.
I can offer you bread, cheese, ham, meat and apples. If you'd like to see my offers, ask me for a trade.
I sell some food.

Mother?! Oh no, now I have to do this all over again.
Where did I put my broom? Mother?
Mhmhmhmhm.

I help my mother to do the housework.

Mother takes good care of us. We never had to worry about anything, with her doing all the... thinking for us.
I wanted to go there once, but mother said I shouldn't.

I don't go outside much.

Mh...
Now I need to clean up everything again.
Could it be...? No. No way.
So much to do, so little time, they say...
Spectulus... I really need to find this guy. I just don't know what to do... what to do... (idle)
They won't believe me anymore, they just won't believe me. Well, my sis is slowly accepting that this was all a lie. I don't know about my mother, though.
My name is Jack. What's your name? Ah yes, Player.
Well, currently I don't have any occupation. Besides my love for sculpting sulky sculptures, like the one in the back there.
It's about 5:09 am.
Don't know. Guess it just doesn't happen much in these parts.
That's me alright. Any problems with that? No? Thought so.

Sometimes, when I really need some time for myself, I take a walk outside. Somehow she always thinks I am up to something when I'm not here. Or maybe she just doesn't want to lose me. But why? I always came back, didn't I.

Well, she is a little older than me and I believe she thinks mother favours me in some way because I am the youngest. I wouldn't know for sure, however. And mother always keeps her busy. Not that she'd never complain, though.
Gesundheit! It seems you caught quite a cold.
I... was... sculpting sulky sculptures. For all my life. Until you came in here and DESTROYED MY MASTERPIECE. Go away. I don't like you.
I don't care about much outside of my home here in Edron. And why should I even.
Yep, that's my home. Nice city and all. Been here all my life, don't intend changing this.
Mh, never been that far.
Well, Tibianus is a good king as far as I can tell. On the other hand, I don't care about him much as long as I can do what I like to whenever I want to.
Good to know that they're there to defend us. I for one would never join the army, though.
I'm pretty modest when it comes to furniture - the less, the better. I need room im my room.
Ah, also a keen lover of arts I assume? You might have already caught a glimpse of that humble masterpiece over there in the corner - I sculpt sulky sculptures! ...

Sculpting sculptures was my passion since childhood... ...and it was there at my first sandcastle when... ...and it formed... ...and it developed into... ...years of enduring sculpting... ...carved of something like... ...sulky... ...
And that's what I like to do to this very day - hey, hey will you wake up? Were you even listening to me?
Never heard about that.
Yes yes. Goodbye Player.
Be greeted, living soul!
It has been a while since I roamed the world of the living in a mortal shell.
I had many names in my live. The one that would be the most recognizable is probably the name Goshnar. Even that was an assumed name that I took, when i left my mundane past behind.
I was once known as the necromant king. ...
For some it was meant as a curse, others used the name with reverence. To me it was just another stepping stone, in a life that burned with ambition.
My ambitions were high and knew no limits. Mastery over life and death was but a milestone that I wanted to accomplish. In the end I aspired probably somewhat like godhood. ...
Though in hindsight even that wouldn't have been enough. There was a hunger in me that nothing could put to rest.

Everything in my life was just a tool to further my goals. The brotherhood of bones was just a tool for me. As was everyone or everything. In the path I had chosen nothing mattered but me and my ambitions.
Necromancy was a passion at first, another tool while I amassed power and a crutch when my ambitions surpassed that what it could accomplish.
I was so convinced about my brilliance, my greatness, my destiny. And this hunger for more, it let me not have peace at any point in my life. I was always driven. There was no time to rest. ...
And there was no looking back. I never cared to remember my humble beginnings, what I had sacrificed to get where I was. All that I had left behind and that I had lost forever. ...
Now I see the bitter irony. I could bring back the dead, but I couldn't create second chances. I couldn't restore the truly important things that I had lost.
My demise did not meet me unprepared. As a powerful necromancer I had fettered my soul in the living world and the realms beyond. I had prepared for my return and was confident in my power.

My soul wandered the plains of Zarganash, waiting for my wards to power up. Waiting for my soul to be slowly pulled back and manifest in the world of the living once again. What I had not taken into consideration was peace.

Zarganash was not a place without it's dangers but for a soul as powerful as mine, there was little threat at all. For the first time in my existence I had to stop running forward. I had to wait for things to fit into their places. ...
And me, who had seen things that horrible, they would have obliterated a lesser man's mind, finally took the time to look back. And what I saw was frightening in its own right. ...
A great tiredness overcame me. With the flames of my ambitions calming down for the first time since I could remember, all my aspirations and plans seemed to petty and futile. ...
Everything I had worked for and my plans for the things to come seemed pointless and the things I had lost and never allowed myself to experience weighted heavily on my soul.
I talked to other souls, lost in Zarganash and most of them seemed like mirrors to myself. Their faults, their shortcomings, the things that were important to them and the things they had lost. ...
It was all like miniature copies of my own grand plans and losses. It made me think. And the great tiredness weighted even more heavy on me. A weariness of the world, of the hunger that drove me.
Then I met a wise soul. A teacher that did not lecture. I never was impressed by anything but my own accomplishments but the inner balance and peace of this soul, it did impress me. A lot. ...
I, who fancied myself to have been the epitome of knowledge, learned things that were entirely new to me. But this knowledge wasn't about power. It was about me.
I recognized the extent of my folly and failure. I decided not to return to the world of the living.
I decided to stay here, even pass on into the great beyond at some point. Yet I still feel the pull of my fetters. I can faintly hear those who think they are my followers, calling to me. ...
And I feel others, many others who carve for my powers and try to bring me back for their own gain.
Over my time in Zarganash I split away the parts of me that my worldly fetters where bound to. Yet I had to recognize that they are still a part of me and I'm bound to them. ...
The fetters and the efforts to call me back, are empowering them. I feel them growing in strength and gaining awareness on their own. ...
They are beginning to feed not only on the fetters and incarnations but also on me. As I grow weaker they grow more powerful over time.

The only way I can get rid of them is to disperse them, to 'kill' them so to say. But they are tainted parts of myself and even going near them might endanger my sanity and stability. So all I can do is to ask you to do this daunting task.
I'm aware I have no right to ask and I have little to offer as a payment, but I ask you nonetheless. Will you face my fettered vices and destroy them for me?
Thank you for accepting this burden.

You will have to reach each of the negative parts of my personality, I split away. They are hidden deep in the depths of Zarganash and will have corrupted and twisted their surroundings into dangerous nightmares. ...
Even worse you'll likely encounter minions of those who want to claim my soul as their prize, for their own, depraved reasons. You will have to destroy my shards to set me free.
You haven't killed Malice yet. You haven't killed Hatred yet. You haven't killed Spite yet. You haven't killed Cruelty yet. You haven't killed Greed yet.

I hated the world for its flaws and the reluctance of people to comply to my will. I was convinced I was destined for greatness and to change everything. Ordinary beings were far beneath me and my consideration. ...
All this opposition, all the wars were a nuisance on my way to greatness. I would have sacrificed the whole world ton reach my goals.

My daughter was as ambitious as me, yet she lacked my intellect and my raw talent. She still was great and talented yet I sadly let her feel my disdain. One of the many errors that my way of hubris made me do.

Even in the lands of the dead this one caused a stir. The dead were whispering his name. It made me feel jealous and angry at first, but at some point, after much self reflection, I could recognize my own faults in the stories about him. ...
It was almost like looking into a mirror for the first time. However he lived way later than me and I never met his soul here so I can't tell more about him.
I'm not aware of the fate of my linage. Neither I'm able to relate to the mortal world in that way. Each of us is an individual, not bound by ties of blood or herritage.
His avatar might be destroyed for now and it'd grip on Zarganash considerably weakened. Yet he burrowed to deep into the essence of this realm to be annihilated this easy.

They called me the necromant king, in an act of reverence, but to me it was always more of a slander. To limit my greatness to this insignificant aspect was an insult to my ego. But I let it slip for the greater good. ...
I felt it was beneath me to correct them and I went along.
I despised my followers for their petty agendas and for their limited vision of my own goals and personality.
Be greeted in peace ... for now.
My name is of no concern to you!
I'm a priestess of Zathroth.
You misled fools know nothing about the truth. The lies that your temples feed you have poisoned your mind! ...
Zathroth is the source of everything. When the other gods hesitated to do the necessary to start creation it was Zathroth who stepped forward and took it upon him to commit the great sacrifice.
Even before the priests of Zathroth were banished from the cities, they spread lies to poison the mind of the people. ...
When the priests had left it became even worse, and now after several generations of lies and propaganda, all what is left in the minds of the people is a fabricated scarecrow.
Zathroth teaches us that without sacrifice there is no progress and everything you gain is connected to a burden.
A burden comes in many shapes. Often it is the burden of knowledge. Sometimes it is the burden of necessity.
There is no knowledge that is forbidden. If you are powerful enough to take it, it is yours. Be aware though that knowledge for the sake of knowing alone is a sin in the eyes of Zathroth. ...
Those who 'know' are entitled to act! The more you understand the more you are responsible to change things even when the ignorant world will blame you for that.
Doing the necessary is always a burden. Ignorant people will blame and fear you for your actions. Some things that have to be done are not going to make you popular. ...
More often than not people won't understand your actions. Often it is not possible to explain things at all.
It's not wise to enter this part of the complex. Whereas intruders such as you are not welcome anywhere in this area, in the area upstairs war holds reign.

Since the days before men walked Tibia, two races of demons wage war against each other in the halls above. The reasons for that war are that numerous that recalling half of them would require several weeks. ...
And each day of war adds more reasons to it. The only reason for them to stop their war for a moment would be to crush any intruders.

The war of the demons has reached an eternal stalemate. Only intruders might tip the scales of favour for a while. But even the side profiting from such an intervention would not be grateful since they would feel their advantage is a cheated one. ...
Should one side get considerably weakened, the other will take more hold in the complex. ...

Eventually the more powerful side will be able to summon their leaders to our plane and will dominate the battlefield for a while. Eventually though, a backlash of the other demons will drive them back and the stalemate is restored.
The word 'demon' is extremely imprecise. It is like a baby calling everything with four legs a 'cow'. ...
There are demons that are more a tool than a sentient being. Then there are demons whose intellect dwarfs the greatest minds of humanity. ...
Some are unique, others belong to races and subspecies and even in a given demon race the differences might be extreme.
This isle holds many secrets. You will have to figure them out on your own though. Knowledge comes only to the worthy.
The demon war is in a stalemate once again.
Zathroth is watching you.
Your fate is not yet sealed.
You are speaking the language of animals? I'm surprised. But I'm not in the right mood for a chat.
My name is long forgotten.
I'm a wolf ... or I was one. Now I'm a ghost, haunting this place because I can't find peace.
Time is not important, neither to wolves nor to ghosts.
I'm heartbroken. My puppies were taken from me ... But as I said, I don't want to talk right now. Please leave me alone.
Some strange creatures appeared around here recently. They look like animals but they are something different.
I guess I will stick around for a time to watch over the grave. After this final watch I will find peace, I can feel this. Thank you, human being. You redeemed me.
Farewell.
Greetings, young (man / lady). Looking for a passage or some fish, Player?

Of course, just browse through my wares.
Goodbye. It would be nice to see you again.
Greetings!
My name is Owin.
Yes, that's my name.
I'm actually a hunter. Or used to be, at any rate. But lately I made some efforts to find out more about the so called Curse of the Full Moon. So I'm also a kind of researcher by now.
It's exactly 3:48 pm.
The savage beasts that frequently threaten Grimvale grow bolder again. With the full moon they may overrun this village.
You should see Maeryn, she may have some errand for you.
She's a close friend and something of a protector for this village. Stunning woman. Fearless and unsurpassed with the bow.
Our village druid still lives here, and has done since she was a little girl. Any were-creature body parts you find, she will trade you for some coin.
The ferryman? Used to be a fisherman. Makes a living by sailing between Grimvale and Edron these days.
This island you are standing on. It used to be such a peaceful and placid place. But now it has become dangerous to live here.
So you don't know it yet. This village and the whole island are affected by were-sickness. We also call it the Curse of the Full Moon.
Humans transform into wild beasts: wolves, boars, bears and others. If you want to know more, feel free to read the parchment here on my cot. I wrote down all my insights.
At full moon humans transform into wild beasts: wolves, boars, bears and others. Some call it the Curse of the Full Moon, others think it is a kind of sickness.

Yes, friend, werewolves indeed dwell here on Grimvale. The were-sickness transforms peaceful villagers into savage beasts. Though we don't know exactly how this curse has come upon us, there's no denying it is here.
The few, mostly abandoned cottages you see here. The village is called Grimvale, as is the island.
There are old legends about a subterranean temple that was once built in this area. I don't know the details, but Maeryn could tell you more, I guess.

It can be assumed that powerful were-creatures should be fought with the help of silvered traps. A common leghold trap can be primed with liquid silver and thus be very effective against were-creatures. I believe Gladys could sell you a trap.
Liquid silver is not easy to be found. But at full moon there are some spots in the tunnels under Grimvale where you could find this rare substance.
I'm sorry, I fear I know nothing about the moonlight crystals. But I heard Maeryn talking about them once. Perhaps she can give you a hint.
Farewell.
Greetings, visitor. I wonder what may lead you to this dangerous place.
Welcome back, visitor!
My name is Maeryn.
Yes, that's me.
I'm the protector of this little village. A bit of a self-proclaimed function, I admit, but someone has to watch over Grimvale. It is a dangerous place.
It's exactly 12:29 am.

So you don't know it yet. This island, Grimvale, is affected by were-sickness. Many pitiful, who are stricken with the curse, dwell in the tunnels and caverns underneath the village and the nearby hurst.
Yes, pitiful. For they are savage beasts now who regularly come up from below to attack the village. But once they were inhabitants of Grimvale, before they changed.

Through a bite or even a scratch, you may be infected with the were-sickness. If that happens, there is little hope - until the next full moon you'll change into a were-creature, depending on the animal that hurt you.

There is a plant, the purple nightshade. It blossoms exclusively in the light of the full moon and only underground, where the full moon's light is falling through fissures in the surface. Only this plant's blossoms are able to defeat the were-sickness.
It transforms peaceful villagers into savage beasts. We're not sure how this curse found the way into our small village. But one day it began. At first it befell just a few people. ...
In a full moon night they changed into bears and wolves, and tore apart their unsuspecting relatives while they were asleep. ...
Those merely wounded, first thought they were lucky. But then we realised they were changing, too. Later, others assumed the forms of badgers and boars also. ...
But that does not mean they were any less wild or dangerous than the others.

Yes, my friend, werewolves. They dwell here on Grimvale, threatening our life. The were-sickness transforms peaceful villagers into savage beasts. We're not sure how this curse found its way into our small village. But undoubtedly it did.
We are not sure what they are doing down there. We're glad if they stay in the caverns and leave us alone. Only at full moon do they come up and threaten the island's surface and village. ...
I, however, have a hunch as to why they dwell so deep under the earth.
There are old legends about a subterranean temple that was once built in this area. Supposedly many artefacts are still hidden down there. ...
I don't have the time to tell you the entire tale, but there is a book here in which you may read the whole story.

Yes, the story goes that there are ancient artefacts still hidden in the temple ruins, such as helmets in the form of wolven heads, for example. It is said that moonlight crystals are needed to enchant these artefacts.

I see you have found an artefact in the temple ruins. Oh, it's a helmet. I'm sure you could enchant it with moonlight crystals. But a certain preparation seems to be necessary. I could help you, if you wish.
So, which profession would you give preference to when enchanting the helmet: knight, sorcerer, druid or paladin?
So this is your choice. If you want to change it, you will have to come to me again.
As you wish. Come back, if you change opinions.

The moonlight crystals are extremely rare. Supposedly they resemble berg crystal but have a more silvery gleam. My grandmother once told me that they may be used to enchant amulets or other things. But I don't know, whether this is true or just a fable.
If you bring me a common leghold trap and some liquid silver, I may be able to create a silvered trap for you. You could use it to weaken even a powerful were-creature.
You brought some purple nightshade! It's not enough yet, but it's a good beginning.
Three of these blossoms should suffice to heal some afflicted persons. But if you bring more I'd be grateful, of course.
He's basically a ferryman nowadays, but I remember when he was our village's leading fisherman. He offers a ferry service between Grimvale and Edron. You must have met him - he sailed you here.
He's an experienced hunter and knows much about the woods, the animals that dwell there, and about the werewolves. He's devoted himself to finding out everything there is to know about the Curse.

She's an old druid. She's been living here on Grimvale since she was a little girl, just like me. She's very interested in were-creature body parts. If you find any, I'm sure she will love to trade with you.
The small island you are standing on. For a long time it was a peaceful and placid place. But lately it has become more dangerous.
The simple huts you see scattered here. The village is called Grimvale, like the same-named island.

Yes, many centuries ago a big temple was built underneath the island of Grimvale. It was incidentally rediscovered a few years back when one of the village children got lost in the tunnels underneath the island, and found the temple ruins. ...
I wrote down all information about it in my notebook here. Feel free to read it, if you are interested in the temple.
Every month around the 13th, the single Tibian moon will by fully visible to us. That's when the curse hits us hardest. ...

The two days around the 13th, the 12th and the 14th, are considered 'Harvest Moon', those are the best to gather nightshade. However, only after it has reached its apex on the 13th, the curse strengthens. ...
We do not know what happens down there in those tunnels around that time but there is a presence there, we all feel - yet cannot quite fathom. ...
At full moon, humans transform into wild beasts: wolves, boars, bears and others. Some call it the Curse of the Full Moon, others think it is a kind of sickness. ...
During this time, we try to not leave the house, we shut the windows and hope it will pass. The curse will weaken a bit after that but it returns. Every month.

We tried to prevent this really hard. Cornell won't ferry anyone affected by the curse back to Edron. But somehow one or more cursed people must have slipped through the cracks. Now the curse reached Edron, maybe even Cormaya! ...
This is a catastrophe. Please talk to Daniel Steelsoul in Edron.
It causes me great anxiety that the curse has spread and reached other regions of our world. The most serious problem here on Grimvale is, that many villagers were bitten by were-creatures. ...
Until the next full moon they will turn into savage beasts. There is only one way to prevent this: we need enough purple nightshade blossoms. ...
Three of these blossoms should suffice to heal some afflicted persons. But if you bring more I'd be grateful, of course. Would you do that?
Well, that's most unfortunate. Farewell then and take care of yourself.
Thank you! These plants are reported to grow in the tunnels underneath the village, but I don't know the proper location.
You already helped us quite a lot, however, a lot of people are still suffering in the wake of the werecreatures. Thank you for helping us out again.

We tried to prevent this really hard. Cornell won't ferry anyone affected by the curse back to Edron. But somehow one or more cursed people must have slipped through the cracks. Now the curse reached Edron, maybe even Cormaya! ...
This is a catastrophe. I'm sure they need help in Edron but I can't leave Grimvale. The curse is very strong here and my people need me. Would you be willing to travel to Edron and aid them there?
I'm sad to hear that. Come back, if you change opinions.
Thank you so much! Please travel to Edron and talk to Daniel Steelsoul. I'm sure he can tell you more about the spreading of the curse.
Farewell, then.
Hello! I guess you are here for a mission.
I'm Ezebeth of course. To think you've never heard of me, tsk!
I'm the coordinator for several tasks and helpers for our city. Things can become quite chaotic without a firm guiding hand. I also work as an outfitter for privileged helpers of our city.
