Well, our special outfits are limited and there are only so many at one time. ...
So there is little I can do about an outfit, unless someone brings me some scraps of an outfit that he might have found. After that basic outfit is acquired though, I can provide certain addons.
We provide addons to people dedicated to our city. So the first addon is granted to someone who has voted for each of the available shortcuts and each dungeon at least once. ...
The second addon is granted to someone who has voted for each bossfight at least once.
I already heard that the issue has run a strange course. I am sure you'll be able to handle that.
I'm so amazed that it seems unique to our city. It's so natural and common here that I would never have expected that.
Our beloved city should be a role model for the whole world. We have no need for kings and the like. Decisions are made by the people who dedicated their effort to the betterment of the city.
Someone has to do the administration stuff after all.
They arrived a generation ago. They don't belong here and have no right to stay.
The system is just perfect. I'm pretty sure sooner or later the whole world will adapt the system.
A necessary evil. I'm glad that my job keeps me away from that stuff.
I think most of them are just lazy and stupid though a few might have become beggars by bad luck.
That captain is nothing but a myth.
Wasn't he the inventor of the walkers?
The nightmare knights played a major role in liberating our isle. Yet they finally failed as every leader did.
Good bye!
Oh how nice, a visitor! Do sit down.
I am Lady Emily Balfour.

You must be joking, certainly. As if the talk wasn't bad enough already. With my name, who would consider me for any kind of employment in this city? Fortunately, my son is the local knight trainer, or we'd have starved a long time ago.
<melancholy> I do not keep a watch or clock, dear. I've spent too much time alone, I don't want to see how time passes.
I am afraid I don't quite understand you. Do you seek something useful to do? Then please apply at the magistrate. I am sure that a helping hand is always welcome in our city.
It is my maiden name. I use it because mother insisted after Henry vanished and people talked.
She meant well, I am sure. However, she is so sensible of our family name and honour! She blames Henry for what happened. I cannot. It was an accident!

I shall never forget it. The factory lighted up, in a ghastly colour, and a loud bang and a cloud of acid glooth steam evaded! I heard a most terrible scream Henry's voice! And I have heard it ever since, at night...
Oh, that horrible stuff! It was Henry's hobby. His brilliant mind sparkled with ingenious ideas on how to use it, how to improve its uses, how to find new uses. I hate it! It took him from me! <sobs>
You have news again? Fresh news from Henry? How is he? What are his next plans? Will he come back to the city? ...

Oh! Really? You don't say! ... I see. Well, I have waited for so long, I shall endeavour to be patient a little longer. But I long for his return! Oh! Please excuse me, I need a little time to recover from these news. Do come back later!
You have news, news from Henry! What is it? Where is he? Why doesn't he come himself? Is he ill? Captured? Suffering? Dying? Tell me at once, I beg you!
A letter? A letter from Henry! Oh, how wonderful! After all this time! I must read it at once. Oh, you have made me so happy! I shall forever be in your debt!
You have made me very happy in delivering Henry's letter. You shall always be welcome here!
We are not on the best of terms with the rest of the Balfours. Graham is my family.
Well, Alaistar Stanton has been very supportive, but he is such a busy man. I really don't want to bother him. ...
But since Henry is not officially dead, his family fortune has been inaccessible to us. Graham and I had a hard time, but we get by.
Reading is one of the few pleasures still left to me. <sighs> At least in a novel, there's a happy ending.
His appearances became rarer and rarer over the years.
A traitor to the city.
I sometimes go and find a little rest in the temple, yes. Such lovely flowers! Such peace and quiet! And Azalea always has a good word for me. She's a nice girl.
Not even Mr Dee could tell me where Henry is. <sighs> I pray to the gods each day that they will let him return to me.
Never met the girl, though I used to know her mother. Miss D'Albay has a sweet voice, though - I can hear her singing when the wind's right.
<sigh> He was very understanding, and I am sure it was a reasonable price, but I still miss my heirlooms. Times have been hard indeed.
From a charming young lady such as you, I should liked to be called Emily again. Let's be friends. <smiles>
What a wonderful voice she had! I remember seeing her at the opera when I was a girl. <sigh>
Captain Flint is a quiet, reticent man, and I respect that. He and I have a lot in common. We both lost someone dear and do not wish to be reminded of it more often than necessary.
He is the spitting image of his father. Henry would be so proud. Graham finished best of class and is now the new knight trainer. He is such a dear!
I wish Graham would go out more and meet people of his own age. Fyodor Fairfax is a charming idealist, a breath of fresh air in this city! ...
He and Graham could change much to the better in this city, I am sure. But they always seem to have so much else to do, they have not even met yet. <sigh> Well, they should know best.
Who? Ah, young Nicholas Cavendish. Well, I can't afford his fashionable ideas, dear.
Is that the youngest son of the Earl of D'Arbalesse? He was such a cute baby, as I recall.
Mr Carefew has been forced to acknowledge that Henry might be alive, and to grant us access to at least some little money...
He has had to take back some of his slander, and to excuse himself. Though he still tries to throw spokes in our wheel wherever he can. <sighs>
Good bye. Please come back to visit!
Must everybody I like disappear?
Welcome, dear! Can I help you? Are you looking for an instrument?
I am Madame Fayla Thibault. Call me Fay.
During office hours, I sell instruments. In the evenings and by appointment, I teach how to sing and to play an instrument.
Of course, just take a look at my instruments.
<smiles> Yes, dear? Do you want to buy something?
<smiles> Well then, just ask for a trade and have a look!
Ah, so you heard of me? Well, a lot of time has passed since then, my dear. Glorious days, but it doesn't do to repine, does it? Of course it doesn't. <smiles> ...
Now, how about a nice little instrument for your home? Just ask me for a trade and I'll set you right up.
At the moment, I am fully booked, my dear. However, why not come to one of my soires when you have the time? I'll let you know when the next one will be.
Not everyone here can afford his or her own instrument, and I enjoy music. So I made it my duty to teach all who strive to sing and play. After all, music is there to be shared.
Ah, so you heard of me? Well, a lot of time has passed since then, my dear. Glorious days, but it doesn't do to repine, does it? Of course it doesn't. <smiles> ...
Now, how about a nice little instrument for your home? Just ask me for a trade and I'll set you right up.
That was a gift from a very mighty and noble friend. Ah, I could never part with it!
I sell only the finest instruments, if you are interested in a trade.
This is an ...interesting city, as I am sure you have already noticed. I believe you know glooth?
A strange substance that pervades every aspect of city life. Scientists study it, engineers construct with it... in short, it is used for many purposes.
The princible sounds good... but is it sound? <smiles> Ah, have I confused you? Sorry, my dear.
This airtight cloth works splendidly. I have had rather less complaints from my neighbours about the loudness of singing lessons, lately.
My litle proge. She's got a lovely voice. You should visit one of our little soires, you know. <smiles at you>
Good bye.
Oh, hello there! I'll be with you in a minute. Take your time and choose your items. Ask me for a trade if you're ready.
I am Alaistar Stanton. You have met my elder brother Mordecai, I believe.
I mix potions and tinctures. I also study the flora and fauna of Oramond, and am a renown researcher in the field of glooth liquids. If you have found something interesting, show it to me!
Only the finest ingredients! Feel free to browse.
You lost the potion? That is terrible! I only have one small portion left, I don't know if that will suffice for any reaction! Still, better that than nothing. Take it. But BE CAREFUL.
You lost the lozenge? How could that happen? ... Never mind. <sigh> Here. Take this reserve I just mixed together, get a soothe blossom form Azalea and try again. Let's hope it works this time.
You lost the potion? But there it is! Quickly, go back to the laboratory and talk to Henry!
Please leave any message with Maro for the moment, I am very busy with my experiments.
Ah! Yes, it is a hobby of mine, I admit. If you have some interesting creature product you would like to sell, ask me for a trade.
I've studied them for years. Their culture is quite different from ours. If only we could coexist peacefully, oh, the possibilities to learn from each other!
The abandoned factory in the lower part of town. It was the most advanced factory of its time, experimenting with entirely new glooth concepts and improving the design of metal golems. ...
There was a most strange explosion or glooth fire years ago, which burned all living things and contaminated the area. All that knowledge, all gone and ruined... <shakes head sadly>
She has been a trusted friend all these years. She helped me in the experiments with glooth and nature magic, as I hoped to find a cure for Henry's... illness. ...

Though I doubt Henry knew that she was aware of his plight. If only he'd come out openly, we would have stood up for him! But he shut himself away in shame and misery. <sigh> Well, at least now with your help, we have a chance to cure him.
I am glad you have joined our cause, the money is a great help for Emily. Still, I hope that Henry will decide to come out of his hiding, instead of writing her letters every so often. ...

She would draw much support from Henry if he would show himself in town. Yes, even in this hideous form - it would quieten the ugly rumours that were stirred when he disappeared so soon after their marriage.
Fyodor is indeed very able with the pen, it is true. I am glad my hunch there was right. ...
It is a shame we have to resort to such secretive means and - well, forgery of some sort there... but unless Henry shows himself in public, I believe we must go on like this. <sigh>
He is an excellent boy, just like Henry in his younger days! Graham however, long ago ceased to believe his father is still alive. Maybe that's a mercy. ...

It gave him the strength he needed to support himself and his mother through all the hardship. He's a strong and honest man, but the truth about his father's fate will hurt him, if he ever learns about it.

Ah, he is my pride and joy! Who would have thought minotaurs could be that intelligent and diligent? It is time to rethink their status. If only someone could make a peaceful contact. Not that I haven't tried. <shakes head sadly>

I visit and observe their camps regularly, though I have to take care to be heavily camouflaged. They have a most remarkable society and hierarchy. I think they might even worship some sort of god. Fascinating.
Yes, we share an interest for the more practical aspects of magic. He is an expert in the field of runes and wands.
A very brave and sweet-tempered lady. She has been through much. She likes visitors, though she hardly ever has one, these days.
It is really airtight, this cloth - I was able to gather some very volatile gases with this. I am looking forward to my next field trip, when I will use the cloth as a camouflage tent!
Don't waste everything at once!
Always in a hurry, eh?
Ah, hello! You come from our... mutual friend again?
Oh. Okay then. Please, take your time and talk to me again when you have made up your mind.
<reads letter> Of course, Carefew will need a new letter to convince him our friend is still alive. He is always suspicious! I wonder if that man has any real friends. Hah. ...

I will see to it that Carefew will have no reason to doubt the letter's contents! You should see Lady Emily as well, if you have not already done so. She will be happy to hear any news regarding our friend.
I believe you are a friend and a helper in a good cause. We need more like you if we want to make this city a truly great place to live for all the people!
My full name is Fyodor Bariton Fairfax.
I'm your local post office contact. If you have questions about the Royal Tibia Mail System or the depots, ask me. I am also the local news editor.
It is 3:03 pm. If you need a watch, why not visit Edmund or Maro and buy a nice watch?
What shall it be? Pens and papers, or postal wares? Papers on explicit request only; trade will show you our standard postal wares.
Of course, here is our selection of papers and pens. If you need labels, letters or parcels, just ask for a trade.
A brilliant scientist and observer of nature, but not, alas, so very much engaged in town affairs. We could use a steady character such as his in the magistrate!
I wonder how she looks underneath that hood? Have you ever heard such a sweet, gentle voice? She must be the most beautiful creature in the world! <dreamily> If only I could look into her eyes...
She's actually my great-grand cousin. She's always singing and in good humour, though her father really disapproves of her modern views. ...
Her big dream is to sing at the opera, but she makes some fabulous glooth sandwiches, you should absolutely try them.
Thank you for your support in this. I know that as an outsider, our Oramondian affairs must seem small to you, but I assure you, they mean much to us!

She's lived alone all these years and has never accepted her rich family's offer to take her back and remarry her, or even to have her husband declared dead. A remarkable lady! She still hopes he'll come back one day.

A young man of very sober and honourable character. He's helped his mother all these years, but the price he paid is that of hope. He never once believed his father could be alive, as his mother does.
The voice of the upper class of Rathleton, and the Oramondian bank manager. We cordially detest each other.
If you want to offer your help to the city, you should talk to Terrence down at the eastern gate, or to Ezebeth in the magistrate. Both are always looking for helping hands.
Ah, have you perhaps read the 'Oramond Observer'? I try to establish a neutral and objective paper to inform the Oramondian people of everything relevant.
Saw him briefly. I really liked the atmosphere in Thais. Though we do things differently here.
I only visited it briefly.

This is a city of light and darkness! We have achieved so much, yet there are so many things still amiss! We have scientists and mages of great wisdom, but monsters stalk the lower streets while the rich look on! <continues talk in this fashion>

A tool of the people it should be, yet look at how many actually can use their vote? Have you read Thackleby's research on this subject? Oh, you haven't? I can strongly recommend it to you. He writes a very witty column in the Oramond Observer.
I love writing and am also an experienced calligrapher. If you wish to have something copied out, please come to me.
Ah, so you have met our postmaster? I can see we have a lot in common!
That biased paper? It only reflects the selective view of the elite and completely ignores pressing social matters of this town.
If you love music, you should talk to Madame Fayla upstairs. She has some lovely instruments to sell and sometimes, there's a little musical soire.
It used to be just a handful of artist, but nowadays, the soires are crowded with people who think they're important... though some are, of course. Noblesse oblige, I guess. ...

Don't get me wrong, I love music and song, but this kind of soire is really mostly socialising. Madame Fayla still tries to get the magistrate to rebuild the old opera, but I think she's only fooling herself. ...
I have it from a reliable source that the city's not interested in gentrifying the older part of town. What a shame.
I would not have use for such a thing. Who would write on an airtight, watertight cloth? Exactly my point.
I've seen him once as a kid when he battled Mean Green on top of the factory my father worked in. He's for real!
Maxxen was some brilliant scientist a long time ago. Then he became evil though.
Always a pleasure to be of assistance, Simula.
Hello, fellow hooman. You need tools? Equipment? Ask for a trade if you do.
I am Maro.
Yes. That is my name. You wish?
As you see. I am a toolmaker. I make tools.
I make clocks, fellow hooman, not time.
Ask me for a trade to see my tools.
Every tool is beautiful. Practical, simple, elegant. Ask for a trade to see for yourself.
Choose.
I have no memories of the clans. I do not belong there. I make tools.
I was raised in the city by father Alaistar. I live as a hooman. I behave as one. I am one.
You already gave me my letter. Did you see the others?
Maro did not understand that, fellow hooman. Please repeat.
The druid and the postman hoomans. And father Alaistar, and Emily, the lady of fellow hooman friend... You should see them all, they all await his news!
Read the paper. Or ask fellow hooman Fyodor. I do not know. I know how to make tools.
Captain Caveworm was a great warrior of the city.
I don't know that person.
The young female hooman? HER voice makes my teeth tingle. I have made ear plugs, they help.
It is an interesting substance that my fellow hoomans use a lot in their tools.
I admire his craftmanship. He makes most beautiful things out of the hard earths and stones.
Sad lady friend of a friend, very much alone. I feel for her.
He makes weapons. He says they are for defense of fellow hoomans. But where there is a weapon, there is an attack. I prefer to make tools.
He has quick hands and a quick tongue. He can write anything and talks very much. But he has become a friend.
He tries to protect the weak. He is a good hooman.
Uncle is always busy. He does not like to leave his study much. He leaves such things to father and me.
He has interesting ideas for hooman sitting tools. Maro sometimes lends a hand in their construction.
He fights the clans. There is no friendship between him and me.
He is a very important hooman in this city. Many listen to him when he speaks. Or maybe it is because he owns the big house of gold coins.
Sad lady friend of a friend, very much alone. I feel for her.
Ah, the lady friend Emily is a wife, or a widow some say. She is sad and alone. If you have a message for her, she will be glad.
Yes. Good bye.
Hrm.
Hi!
My name is Sholley.
I'm the resource coordinator of Rathleton. I look over our stocks and their usage.
It has some many uses and probably even more to be found out!
This is the only place I know. I think we are better in every respect than any of the other cities though.
We are what holds the city together. Without us, there would be only a mess.
They are our arch enemies!
Voting is essential for any civilised society.
Some strange interests that you have.
They do nothing for the city and get what they deserve.
Even if he'd exists he'd be an unauthorized vigilante and nothing more.
He was secretly a nightmare knight plotting revenge on the city but he was stopped.
They were kings of far away lands and became kings here. But we don't want kings here, so our ancestors got rid of them.
Good bye!
Hello there, friend. If you need new knight spells to protect your loved ones, I am your man.
I am Graham Balfour.
It is my duty and honour to teach knight spells to any knight who wishes to learn.
It is 11:29 am, friend.

I believe your lands are vast and wild? But you seem pretty able to defend yourselves. For my part, my place is here. Oramond has some unknown depths to it from which monsters emerge, and the city needs every help it can get to defend itself.
I know not much else than this city, but I believe it is unique in its way. Naturally, it is not perfect, but what in life is? We can only try to make things better one at a time.
Ah, you touch upon a sensible point. That part of town used to be the oldest and most densely populated, but it has rapidly gone to ruin these last decades. ...
If you wish to help us in our fight against the monsters that roam the streets down there, you are most welcome. Please talk to Terrence at the eastern gate for a mission.

It is my calling to help all those in need. Even as a boy, I saw this. My mother needed protection from all that dreadful talk. Growing up, I saw the city needs protection against the hostile beings that live on the isle. So I became a knight.
I prefer historical books and Dr Stanton's essays on our flora and fauna. Mother finds a litte solace in them, though.

I believe you have found a document that has relieved us of our most pressing debts. I thank you, for my mother's sake and for my own. I can put that money to good use. Things need to change in this city.
Mother lives in the hope of news from father. I do not have the heart to make her accept the hard truth, hope is all she has these days.
Mother has refused to return to grandfather's estate or to remarry, and since then relations have been... icy.

The old factory in the lower part of town? It is infested with monsters. The new factory however conducts some interesting glooth experiments, if you should wish to visit - the workshops are safe. Safe from monsters, at least.
I understand that it is a unique substance that can be treated and used for many things. ...

I, myself, care little for it - it has overshadowed the life of my family these past twenty years. I turn to the simple and true things instead, the honour of being a knight, to protect the weak and help those in need.
It was the place where father built his factory. An ill-fated place, it seems. I do not know much of opera or music, you should talk to Madame Fayla if you are interested in it.
They are hostile and frequently attack our city. Dr Stanton has tried to find out why, but I believe without much success. in the meantime, we knights try to protect the city. ...
If you wish to help, please talk to one of the city guards, or Captain Terrence for further instructions.
Our Captain Caveworm could beat up your Ferumbars or whatever he's called, any time.
Many were killed when he unleashed his walkers upon the city.
That is of no use to me.

Dr Stanton has been a close of friend of my father, and he has tried, in his way, to help mother and me through the hard years. But he is a man of science as my father was, and his word against that of... other people in this town has not changed much.

Mother delights in the flowers she creates and sometimes visits her temple gardens. For myself, I believe the city is fortunate to have such a skilled healer; our casualties would be much higher if it wasn't for Azalea.
Young lady D'Albay? She smiled at me once, but I believe she smiles at everyone.

I know you wish to give me hope, but my father is dead. I have heard many things about him in the last fifteen years, but to believe THAT? Impossible. I have accepted, with a quiet heart now, that he died for his science.

An honest tradesman. Much of mother's private jewellery went to him many years ago, to help us get over the hardest of times. I would buy it back if I could, only to see her a little more happy again.
Mother lives in the hope of news from father. I do not have the heart to make her accept the hard truth, hope is all she has these days.
She used to be a renowned singer in her youth, but when the old opera burned down, the city was against rebuilding it, so Madame Fayla began to give lessons and to sell musical instruments instead.
He used to be my teacher, and I deplore the fact that he resigned from his post after he lost a good friend in an accident.
I know mother wishes us to be friends, but I must own I have little time for anything besides my work. At least it has earned us a little respect.
He seems peacable enough, but I cannot say as much of his kin. Though he believes himself to be a human, who is to say what happens if he ever should be called on to help his people against ours?
Professor Stanton lives for the craft of magic. I don't know if he has ever left his house these last ten years.

The cabinetmaker? Ever since we made contact with your lands, Venorean furniture has been very popular, and his designs are greatly inspired by it, or so I'm told. You can purchase a variety of wares at his furniture shop.
He may seem a little curtly at times, but he is a brave man with a keen eye and good understanding of practical things that need to be done, and do them. ...
If you wish to help us against the minotaurs and fight for the welfare of this city, talk to him. You will find him at the eastern gate.

He's the youngest son of a remarkable family of hunters. His bows and ammunition are of excellent quality, and he is eager to support every initiative against the minotaurs. He has an instinctive dislike for them. It runs in the family.
There seems to have been new evidence he cannot disregard. At least for now we have enough money to begin paying back some of our ancient debts.
Good bye.
Welcome to my shop, Simula! Ask me for a trade if you want to purchase some of my exquisite wares.
Nicholas Cavendish, a pleasure to meet you.

Furniture is my calling! I import only the finest items, and I myself design modern furniture and have it constructed by our local craftsmen. And this is my little atlier. Look around and ask me for a trade if something catches your eye.
It is 12:11 pm. See that fine pendulum clock? It came here only yesterday, the newest design from Venore!
I'd be happy to! Ask me for a trade if you're interested in a certain piece.
Have a look!
What, one man alone? This would never do here! I think it's some centuries since we had that old-fashioned concept on Oramond.

Actually, I believe we started out with a queen, a long time ago. She used to be a ...princess, is that it? I am sorry, you will have to ask our historian for details. My thoughts are all for the present time!
Ah, yes. The magistrate runs things here. You don't have one, you said? Interesting! How can you possibly run your home town affairs?!

Always out and about, studying a plant, a minotaur or other. Though nowadays he's more frequently in his Potion lab than he used to be. He's actually bought a nice piece of Venorean carpet from me, quite recently.
Ah, she rears beautiful plants to adorn your rooms! Her flowers really show to advantage on my new design, you know.
Young Miss D'Albay? Doesn't she take lessons with Madame Fayla upstairs? I think I remember seeing her passing by sometimes when I was busy designing.

The music doesn' bother me, in fact, I find it inspiring! Just yesterday, there was a kind of soire where there was a most interesting piece of music, can't remember the tune right now, but it certainly helped me concentrating on a very difficult design!

The blacksmith? The ladies find him romantic, I don't know why. Something to do with his tragic past. Now, what's really romantic is my newest idea for a tapestry - you will be delighted once I've finished, I swear!
Don't see much of him here. Doesn't seem to be interested in interior design. Well, I suppose there must be such people as well. <shrugs>
Not the man to buy modern design, but I am sure his mother would appreciate a little freshing-up of her aparments in the old barbican!
Ugh, those stains on his old carpet! Really, it was a mercy he let me make a few changes in his store, it was more like a cave than a workshop! ...
A little parquet here, a new carpet there, and voil! Everything's alright again. Never tasted one of his runes he baked, though... oh, those aren't for eating? You don't say!
Don't mention that name! That foolish professor has almost blown up the entire guild of alchemists with his weird tries, and ruined some of my best dyes with his experimenting! ...
I had paid him handsomely for his expertise in watertight colouring and bleaching, and then he went and ruined my entire summer collection on some scientific whim! ...

My only solace is that the magistrate got weary of his inefficient experimenting and denied him access to his labs and workstations. At last we're safe from gas explosions, ruined houses and burnt skin!
Ah, now there is a man who appreciates good interior design! Lady Carefew is one of my loyal customers, a lady with excellent taste!
I must say, his superhuman strength is certainly a help with the more robust pieces of furniture. He lends me a hand or a tool sometimes. Not a bad person at all, for a minotaur.
A fascinating city, they have a very interesting design! And in some respects, not so unlike our own city. ...
But nothing can be compared to Rathleton and our inventions are the newest word anywhere! This is the city of crafts and arts!
Our splendid city. Have you ever seen anything like it? Of course you haven't.
Our island's name is of course not yet much known to outlanders, but wait till our new furniture design reaches your lands! It will be on everyone's lips!
I bet you are quite impressed, are you not? And why wouldn't you be! This is the city of arts, the city of inventions!
Ah, the newest design trends? Oh, you meant other news? I'm sorry, you'll have to ask Fyodor for that, he's always up to date on, er, more worldly areas of interest.
Those creatures attacking us all the time? I wonder, do they want that toolmaker mino back, is that the reason for their onslaught? Oh, well. <shrugs> Maybe they just don't like us.
I think he was in the magistrate once.
My father was a great Captain Caveworm fan as a boy.
A great idea, this airtight cloth! I have already made some lovely sewing patterns, I just have to decide on which one to sew first!
Enjoy your day, Player.
Welcome, Sir. Please, take a look and see if something beautiful catches your fancy. Ask me for a trade when you have made your choice.
Why, certainly. Take your time.
<smiles> Well, it's rather a vocation than a mere job. I am Rathleton's most renowned jeweller and watchmaker.
Currently you can purchase wedding rings, golden amulets, and ruby necklaces. We also buy gold ingots.
Ah, our newest import! We have golden goblets, silver goblets and bronze goblets. All of them have space for a hand-written dedication.
We don't trade with them.
There are white and black pearls you can buy or sell, as well as giant green and brown pearls which you can sell.
Ah, the rough creatures that try to overrun our city? I have not much knowledge about them. You should visit Dr Alaistar Stanton, he collects their products and is a known field researcher.
Our city is one full of creative and pragmatic minds. Not unlike myself. <chuckles>
I do not know much about their work, but things in the city seem to run smoothly enough, it seems.
I don't care much for the hustle and bustle of the outside world. However, if you bring me any gem you find, I might surely know a way how to turn it into a unique jewel!
You can buy and sell small diamonds, sapphires, rubies, emeralds and amethysts or sell topazes.
Of course. Ask me for a trade to have a look at our exquisite pieces.
It is 6:02 am, precisely. Would you care for a wrist watch? I have one there, or could make you a most fetching one.
I am Master Edmund Orlond.
A quiet man. Very given to his work as a blacksmith.
Young Lady D'Albay seems a good-natured girl. She always brings me fresh cookies when she comes to marvel at my jewellery.
Yound Fairfax? He runs the Post Office now, I heard. He is also the editor of the Oramond Observer, a very critical paper. But ah, today's youth. <smiles mildly>

Ah, she was most beautiful in her youth! Well, time is not kind to any of us, and since the opera house burned down, I believe she has had to resort to giving singing and piano lessons, and to selling instruments in her little shop across the plaza.

Ah, what a shame about young Henry Merlay! <shakes head> Such interesting ideas! Such marvellous golem design! If that accident hadn't cost him his life, I believe this city would look different today.
Dr Stanton is a most famous researcher on Oramondian flora and fauna, and a potions specialist. When he's not out collecting information, he runs a shop just over the street.
Who? No!... - Oh, and I thought he had a lovely tan, though a little coarse features! Well, perhaps I should wear my glasses in public.
Professor Stanton is unsurpassed in the art of creating runes and wands. You should visit his Magic Emporium if you wish to purchase magical equipment.
Mordecai and Alaistar Stanton are renowned men in Rathleton, and experts of their craft. Their specialty lies with the more practical arts of magic, rune-baking and potion creation.
I heard he won quite some prizes in archer contests, and is a most succesful minotaur hunter. Naturally, it runs in the family. And bowmaking is virtually their second nature.
Mr Carefew was so kind as to suggest I take up my working quarters in the bank, seeing as it is the safest building, and my works are quite precious.
Bid you good day, Sir.
Welcome, sweetheart! Want a bite to eat? I'll trade!
Sure, here's our menu!
I run the Opera Caf and sell delicacies to go! Ask me for a trade!
I'd be delighted to sell you something! Ask me for a trade to see our list of delicious resfreshments and provisions.
Traditionally, it's Miss D'Albay, but you may call me Christine. <flashes you a smile>
I was named after my grandmother. Did you know that she established this caf? She was a very forward-thinking lady.
Mother disapproves of me running the caf. She thinks I should be getting married and leave the shop to my younger brother Cedric. But I love it here! You meet so very many interesting people!

Grandmother Christine was a fabulous baker and even continued to run the shop when she was married. That annoyed quite some elder people in the higher society! But if it hadn't been for her, things would never have moved in this city.
Father thinks I have too many fancy ideas and that I will quietly settle down once I'm married. <winks> Well, I believe I will continue just fine the way I am!
We used to have one, but after that dreadful fire one day it was torn down and an experimental glooth factory was established instead. ...
That didn't go well, either; the factory's been closed for years and the whole area is, quite frankly, gone to rack and ruin. I'd love to rebuild the opera, though. <sighs>
The stuff Rathleton's dreams are made of! <winks> Seriously, honey, I make some delicious sandwiches and steaks out of it. Ask me for a trade to find out for yourself!
Hmm, yes, I see the idea, but does it work? It's just an idea so far. I'd like to see such a cloth.
It works a treat! My glooth cake keeps fresh now for much, much longer.
Really? How romantic! We haven't had a king or queen for a long time. It really didn't work for us, I don't know why. Maybe the historian or some old history book of his can tell you more.
Your lands sound fascinating! When I get married, I will make sure my husband takes me for a honeymoon there.

He can be so funny! And the way he talks about his ideas for the city! Father disapproves of him, of course. But I think this place could go much forward if Fyodor had a say in matters. Is it true he vistied your capital city? What's it like there?
Lady Balfour's son? He lives for his duties as a knight. When his father disappeared, mother dropped the acquaintance entirely.
He's a true artist of interior design! Mother had all of our mansion's rooms refurnished according to his plans.
Oh, Madame Fay is such a great singer! I take lessons there, I hope one day I'll be as accomplished as her. She was very famous in her youth. ...
She sang the leading roles in the Opera House before it was torn down. If I make enough money some day, I'll have it rebuilt, no matter what father says! ...
Dr Stanton is such an interesting man! Did you know he goes out there into the wild, fearless, and studies Oramonds wilderness? What a man!

She's nice, but she does not go out much. I think she's a little shy with people. The only thing we ever talked about was her flowers. They are lovely though, you should have a look when you're at the temple!
He makes the most gorgeous jewellery you can imagine. I love to visit him, just to look at his wares! If I ever get married, I will make sure to buy at least half of his stock at once!
He keeps to himself. What a tragic hero! He saved so many, but his own friend he could not save - is this not like in one of the great novels?
That minotaur that Dr Stanton brought with him from the fields? I believe he is not very musical.
I was quite afraid of him as a child, his bushy eyebrows and his mumbling always made me think of an evil sorcerer! But he's quite a nice old man, even if he's a little distracted.

Mother would love for me to marry into the family. The D'Arbalesses are one of the oldest families on the island. At least, one of the oldest that we know of. Some even say that they're descended from elves! <laughs>
He's a great friend of father's. Very respectable, and a bore through and through! 'Money this, glooth papers that...' - it's time for a fresh breeze in this stuffy city!
Bye, bye, love!
Welcome to my humble abode. If you come for new sorcerer spells, you have come to the right place.
Ah, hello there, my young friend. Do you have those pollen I asked for?
My name is Barnabas Dee.
I am an astrologer, navigator and mathematician. Oh, and I also teach sorcerer spells.
Sorry, I don't teach spells for your vocation.
Judging by the height of the sun and the alignment of the stars, it is 10:33 am.
Ah! Did you bring me the peppermoon bell pollen I asked for?
Take care, child.
Greetings, Simula. Well, we all know what time it is. Always when we meet, the citizens of Rathleton voted for Bullwark! ...
Well, the rules are as simple as always. Ask me for a fight and I'll teleport you into the room with the lever, therefore I'll charge one voting right. ...
From this room there is no way back to me. Pull the trigger and after one minute you and your buddies will face Bullwark.
A furious, devastating lump of meat and muscles. He is pure destruction. Take care!
Do you really want to enter Bullwark's hideout. There is no chickening out and I also have to charge one voting right! Yes or no?
Return when you changed your mind.
Bye and return soon, Simula.
Good day to you, Sir. How may I be of assistance? Bank business, perhaps?
Virgil Carefew, at your service.
I am the director of the Oramond Island Bank.
It is 5:58 am, precisely.
The name runs in our family since generations, and is traditionally given to the firstborn son.

Those creatures are a constant threat. I am glad that our city guards take care of protecting the city against their continual raids! However, if you could spare some time, I am sure some assistance would not come amiss.
What a modern idea. I see no practical use at present.
We may be interested in trading further goods and glooth products, but that will be voted on by the magistrate.
The wealth of our city. Did you know that it is of animal origin? There is a book about it somewhere, I am sure.
I can recommend the Old Opera Caf just next door. Miss D'Albray makes a most delightful and nourishing glooth sandwich, and sells provisions to adventurous natures.
Ruled by a king? We had a princess, once. Ah, that was long ago. Primitive times.
The new factory will surely prove beneficial to Rathleton's financial success.

The lower part of the city is, sadly, quite derelict. It used to be the heart of the older Rathleton town, but times have changed, and with the discovery of glooth, some have prospered and some have not. ...
Nowadays, only the poor and destitute live there. However, rents in the lower part of town are low, which is why scientists and tradesmen continue to run their business near the harbour.

I am unable to relate the exact sayings of the lower caste to you, but I believe that most gossips emerge from the older part of town. Ask someone in any tavern there, and you will hear all the sailor's yarn you can possibly wish for.
Yes, the magistrate executes the will of the people. It is a most remarkable institution. If you wish to learn more about our city, you should visit Barazbaz, the magistrate's historian.

Those creatures are a constant threat. I am glad that our city guards take care of protecting the city against their continual raids! However, if you could spare some time, I am sure some assistance would not come amiss.
I've never seen anything that can be attributed to him.
He turned evil and built a golem army to destroy the city. But he was stopped.
I read in the Oramond Observer that gloothomir papers are still in high demand,whereas the gloothine seems to be suffering a sudden loss of favour.
I am sorry, I do not discuss other clients' matters with a third, as a rule.
Ah, yes. Mr Orlond has rented the upper storey. You will find there a selection of the finest Oramondian jewellery.
Ah. <coldly> Our local post officer and news editor. I believe you will find him quite outspoken on political matters of Oramond, if a little inclined to drama.
Professor Stanton is an expert on runes and wands. He used to teach sorcerer spells as well, but has now left that post to his close friend, Mr Barnabas Dee.

That minotaur Dr Stanton brought with him from a field trip is a constant source of danger, a threat to our city! Sadly, Dr Stanton perseveres in a most unfortunate naivete regarding his 'foster-son'.
Our local knight trainer. <sniffs> He does a fairly good job, or so I am told. Please excuse me, I have pressing matters to attend to.
Dr Stanton is one of our most renown researchers in the fields of magical liquids and Oramondian botany. ...

He has written extensive works on the minotaurs especially, and thinks it possible to communicate with them. <sniffs> Imagine that! Communicate with our enemies! It needs a scientific mind like Dr Stanton's to have such a ... peacable notion.
Our local historian is well versed in our city's past. Feel free to visit him - or to read through our library in the magistrate.
Mr Dee has a somewhat unusual hobby - he is an astrologer. Or was it astronomer? Please excuse me, I am not an adept in these things. Ah yes, and he also teaches sorcerer spells.
A very ancient family of impeccable repute. Silas, the youngest son, is a proficiant bowmaker and learned paladin trainer. You should visit his shop if you need ammunition.
Young Miss D'Albay indulges in running a little business these days, but I am certain you will find her glooth sandwiches to your taste.
An energetic man, and also the captain of the city guards. If you wish to undertake a mission for the city, he is the man to talk to.
Enjoy your day, Sir.
Hi!
I'm Jondrin, thanks for asking.
I'm responsible to oversee several technical aspects necessary to run our city smoothly. The most important task is to keep records about several data that is measured by our helpers.
Sometimes I feel a bit uneasy about our reliance on this single resource, but there is nothing to be done about it.
I'm so proud of being able to do my part in making this city a better place.
The magistrate is what keeps things running smoothly.
As if we hadn't enough problems already. The sooner we destroy them, the better.
I don't get it how other cities regulate stuff. One person ruling everything? Ridiculous!
I guess we should have funded the sewer maintenance a bit more. Now it's a bit too late to patch things up.
I fear they might carry vermin and illnesses with them. We should get rid of them for good.
Like caveworms he's immortal. Every few years he sheds his skin and becomes youthful again.
A tragic victim of his own genius.
Knights are relics of ancient days. The future has no place for any of them.
You need a necrometer? I gave you one for free, you'll have to buy another one, but I'll offer it at a discount price just for you.
Here it is.
Yeah, bye bye.
Hello, citizen. If you need equipment, ask for a trade.
Make your choice, friend.
I am the local blacksmith. I used to be a soldier and city guard, and the equipment I forge is meant to keep the people safe.
I buy glooth-based equipment, if you have some to sell, ask for a trade.
<grinds teeth> The plague of this island. You will need equipment against them. Ask me for a trade.
One floor upstairs, friend.
Wounded by the minos, eh? Azalea can stitch you up.
Certainly. Ask me for a trade to browse through my stock.
I am interested in buying glooth-based weapons and armors or other local equipment you found. Just ask me for a trade.
Captain Caveworm is the hero of the people, a champion of the weak.
Hm, sounds unfamiliar.
It is 11:46 am, citizen.
None of your business.
I am Captain John Flint.
Yes. Exactly.
Lovely voice. Good glooth sandwiches.
Talks a lot. Good soul underneath.
You need knight spells? Go see him in the old barbican. Two houses down the street.
Strange lad. Head full of tapestry and clocks.
Still a beautiful woman. Carried a torch for her in my youth. Heh. Sells instruments now, doesn't she?
Fancy ideas about minotaurs. Intrepid man, though.
Local druid. Good healer and teacher. Rears some nice flowers, too.
Benign gentleman, keen on gems. Short-sighted like a mole, though.
The toolmaker mino? An exception to the rule.
Only interested in making runes and wands. If you need magical equipment, go see him.
One floor upstairs, friend.
Bank manager. Very influential. Don't get on his bad side, friend.
Be well, citizen.
Greetings! I guess you are here for the voting.
My name is Marvin.
I'm overseeing the most important voting process, which is of utmost importance to the existence of the city of Rathleton.
I'm responsible for overseeing the voting process. Are you here to learn more about the voting, your amount of voting rights, your citizen rank status or do you want to vote on a topic?
In a city like Rathleton there are always many decisions to make and all those citizen fellows or those pursuing to become citizens are allowed to take part. ...
By rendering services to the city everybody can achieve voting rights and thus can cast votes in several topics. ...
Each vote you cast affects your citizen rank and the higher your citizen rank, the more options to cast votes you have. ...
As you can see, it's quite easy. Here you can check out the topics you can vote on.
There are various privileges connected to your citizenship rank. As a Commoner, you get access to Alaistar's services and can sell certain creature products to him ...
You also are entrusted with some more challenging hunting tasks such as killing bloodbeasts and several minotaurs. Just ask the guard Terrence if you have the rank. ...
As an Inhabitant you get further rights. Talk to Flint if you have any looted equipment to sell and Terrence might have even more challenging hunting tasks for you. ...
As a Citizen you can use the slooth to travel more easily from the city's centre to the outskirts and back to the city. Of course even more hunting tasks are available to you. ...

As a Squire at last you attained the highest honours of Rathleton. This honorary title may lead you to a special challenge, concealed deep under the city. However, these are just rumours. To find the truth you have to go and investigate by yourself.
Today you might vote for a shortcut, dungeon, bosses or raids.
So far you earned 25 votes. Each single vote can be spent on a different topic, but you can also cast all your votes on one voting. ...
Well, in the topic shortcut you have the possibility to vote for shortcuts back from the minotaurs, fungi or catacombs.
So far you earned 25 votes. Each single vote can be spent on a different topic, but you can also cast all your votes on one voting. ...
Well, the dungeon you have the possibility to vote for can be full of golems, minotaurs or the wrath of evil.
So far you earned 25 votes. Each single vote can be spent on a different topic, but you can also cast all your votes on one voting. ...
Well, in this topic you have the possibility to vote for bosses: the furious moohtant Bullwark, the poisonous Lisa or the mighty Glooth Fairy.
So far you earned 25 votes. Each single vote can be spent on a different topic or you're also able to cast all your votes on one voting. ...
Well in the topic raid you have the possibility to vote for minotaurs, mechanical creatures or wild life.
How many of your 25 votes do you want to cast? 25 Player: 1 Did I get that right: You want to cast 1 of your votes on [target]?
Thanks, you successfully cast your vote. Feel free to continue gathering votes by helping the city! Farewell.
Sorry, but I didn't understand you. How many of your 25 votes do you want to cast on Bullwark?
Currently, you have 25 voting rights.
Your current citizen rank is squire. Congratulations, Simula! At the moment you cannot promote further.
I wonder how other cities can live without it.
I think our city is the biggest and most advanced in the whole world.
The magistrate is so to say the first servant of the people.
Only the beggars hang out at this disgusting place.
The magistrate provides food and such even for them.
I wonder who is the driving force behind them. They seem too primitive to become such a threat to our glorious city.
They were evil knights that tried to suppress our ancestors.
There is no Captain Caveworm, I assure you.
He was some criminal inventor many years ago.
Good bye, Simula.
Welcome back, friend. If you have not done so, please visit the others. Or have you lost something you need to bring our mutual friend?
I am Azalea, the druid.
I am the local healer and teacher of druid spells. And I also grow flowers. If you want to take a living flower home with you, trade with me.
Here are the little ones.
<Looks at the sun, then at her flowers> It is 10:58 pm, Simula.
You aren't looking that bad. Sorry, I can't help you. But if you are looking for additional protection you should go on the pilgrimage of ashes or get the protection of the twist of fate here.
You do not need any healing right now.
You lost the little one? I can only give you one other, but be careful, brother.
If you have lost something, try to go back to the place where you first found it. Maybe you will get it again from there.
My newest breed, though it took a long time to rear it. They are beautiful, but fragile magic blooms, fed and imbued with powerful healing magic. Will they work as intended? We will have to see.
The fragile and fragrant beauties of the lands! I rear them and try to find new breeds that can hold magic, as well. It is a difficult task and takes up much of my time.
You have a letter for me? Ah, it is at the postmaster's. Very well. Thank you for telling me.
It is made by the gloothworms, and can be used for many things.
Captain Caveworm is the peoples hero, fighting for the poor and weak.
I've never heard that name.
No, I don't see the use that, neither for my plants nor for myself. It upsets the balance of the elements. winds blow, waters flow. Bar their way and they will only grow in violence.
A noble character with a deep understanding of the magical fluids. I respect his wisdom and his energy.
An upright soul, but torn between his past and his present, a tree that the storm will uproot, should there ever be a choice between his kind and his belief.
I am glad you chose to help, and confident that in time, we will be able to cure this poor creature and restore it to its natural form. I will rear more potent blossoms for this.
We share a belief, the belief that we need to protect those who need help. One day, he might change the fate of this city.
Be well, citizen.
Hello, friend. If you need bows or spears, ammunition or paladin spells, then ask for a trade.
I am Silas D'Arbalesse, from the known family of bowmakers.
I am a hunter and trainer of hunters. And I teach paladin spells to those of my kind.
It is 7:45 pm, exactly.
My offers are bows, crossbows and ammunition. Ask me for a trade to browse through them. I also teach paladin spells.
Sorry, I don't teach spells for your vocation.
Make your choice, friend.
I don't buy used bows. If you want to buy one, just ask me for a trade.
I don't buy used crossbows. If you want to buy one, just ask me for a trade.
I sell all sorts of arrows for bows and different bolts for crossbows. Ask me for a trade if you're interested to see my wares.
Yes, I sell spears. Ask me for a trade if you're interested to see my wares.
I have normal arrows, sniper arrows, flaming arrows, shiver arrows, flash arrows, earth arrows and onyx arrows used with bows. Just ask me for a trade.
I have bolts, piercing bolts and power bolts used with crossbows.
You seem staggered by it. The invention of glooth added to the uniqueness of our city, I believe - there is no glooth in your lands, I understand?
A strange substance, gained, I think through some sort of process from an animal. Our historian in the magistrate, or Dr Alaistar Stanton, can surely explain it better to you than I can.
A kind and intelligent man, but too naive in his dealings with the minotaurs. You'd better purchase some sturdy bow if you go out there to their camps, friend.
I believe he is an able knight trainer with high moral standards. No wonder he should have a dislike to anything base, given his tragic family history.

His father disappeared under mysterious circumstances, leaving his wife without any support. Lady Emily Balfour had fought her family for this marriage, only to be left shortly afterwards to their mercy.
Very determined not to lose another friend ever again, so he fabricates the best armors and weapons that a blacksmith can.
He has some radical ideas for the city, but maybe the senior magistrates will cool him down a little.
A very learned man in the ways and craft of magic, but he has lost interest in all worldy dealings. He makes runes and wands to sell, now.
His designs are not to my taste.
A lady of obscure family who used to be a renowned opera singer in her youth, and teaches half Rathleton how to play the piano. She runs a shop for musical instruments, now.
The captain of our city guards is one of my best customers. He is always in need of helping hands in his struggle against the minotaur onslaught, if you should seek a worthy task.
Better stay upwind of him. Who knows if he may not resolve to spy on us for his minotaur kin?
She has some very modern views, for a young lady of her noble lineage.
A true craftsman with gems and precious metals. Maybe I will have some inlaid work for him to be done, for the new improved crossbow models.
A very learned man in the ways and craft of magic, but he has lost interest in all worldy dealings. He makes runes and wands to sell, now.
One of our most respectable citizens, from an ancient family. A leading figure in society.
They remind me a little of the ballads of old. I wish, however, that we had a bard in this city, to remind the people of our heritage. Nobody would need novels then! ...

Unfortunately, not much knowledge of our past has survived, only some rumours and fragments of the days of founding of Rathleton. You should talk to our historian at the magistrate if you are interested to learn more.
That guy had to be about a hundred years old or so by now.
He was an inventor that betrayed our city to the minotaurs and sold them all our secrets.
Those brutish creatures cannot share the island with us. We should eradicate their kind, once and for all, or we shall never be safe.
Stay upwind, friend.
Nice stealth technique.
Oh, hello there!
I'm known as Barazbaz.
I'm the historian of Rathleton and I'm also responsible for the city archives. A most important job, as you might have guessed.
You just need it for everything.
I heard that in other cities a single person decides everything. That must be a very rich and busy person, to get all those votes for his own. ...
To live there must be wonderful, as that single person does so much there is nothing left to do for the others.
I heard other cites have an army to handle such threats. Perhaps we should vote to create one.
Voting is the power of the people!
They are needed to keep the city clean.
There are only so few beggars, it's not even worth mentioning them.
Thanks to this cloth, I was able to safely store away one of my most prized relics that would otherwise be lost to the mould. History is in the debt of the inventor.
I tell you: everything related to that Captain Caveworm guy is made up out of some random events.
When they did not choose him into the magistrate he let his golems loose in the city and fled.
It's good such things are buried in the past.
Yes, yes. Good bye.
Welcome to the magic emporium, child. Ask me for a trade if you need runes, wands, or spellbooks.
I am professor Mordecai Stanton.
I craft runes and wands and sell magical equipment of all sorts here in our humble establishment. <bows>
Indeed! Ask me for a trade to choose from my wares.
Choose wisely! Or maybe you want to look only at wands or runes?
Naturally. You can also look at runes.
Naturally. You can also look at wands.
All right then, just browse through all of my wares.
I am not familiar with the workings of the city, I am afraid. I take little interest in the workings of the, er, non-magical kind, I confess. ...
Young Fairfax, I mean Fyodor, is better informed. And of course you can always ask the city guards, or the magistrates, on what's going on.
The minotaurs here on Oramond are quite vicious creatures, with a ... grudge against our city. I always fear for Alaistar when he is out collecting herbs, but he won't listen. <sighs>
I used to teach, but I have retired. Now, I indulge in the arts and crafts of magic.
Ah, no, no, no, my teaching days are over. Nowadays, my good friend Barnabas teaches sorcerer spells to the magically gifted.
Never really been one for all that ado about healing, I admit. Use your runes wisely, I always say! However, if oyu need a druid, go to our temple and ask Azalea, our healer.
Never heard that name.
In truth it's a whole subversive movement, that used this cover for their activities that are aimed at destroying our town.
My younger brother is a renowned potion maker, researcher, hobby archeologist and quite the expert on the field of the local fauna and flora. It's somewhat of a calling, I believe.
I am not sure the girl was called that name by her parents, but druids have their own ways. She is a superb healer nonetheless, and also grows charming room plants, if you need some.
Ah, so you are interested in the higher arts as well? Commendable. He lives next door, on the top floor.
There seems to have been some commotion lately with view to his family fortune, or so Alaistar told me. But I hardly concern myself with city matters these days.
He visited your capital and became a postman, didn't he? He's a bright fellow, and has some interesting ideas. Writes articles and has some high-flown ideas for his newspaper, but no harm in that.
My brother found him as a whelp, left for dead next to an abandoned battlefield. He brought him here and raised him as... well, a human. It was a fascinating subject of study.
Carefew plays a leading role in society, or at least he used to when I was still teaching. Very influential man, though he never was a magistrate member.
Take care, child.
Ah, the impetuosity of youth.
Greetings. Have you eliminated the glooth bandits?
You don't seem honest. Perhaps you go out and eliminate some more.
Well, I'll wait.
I'm Drystan Wildweed.
I'm a druid, a guardian of nature. And especially I'm the warden of these caves.
It's exactly 2:28 am.

This is a slimy substance which is produced by the glooth worms. It was a driving force for the progress in Rathleton. In the city they say that it has great potential but in my view the risks outweigh the benefit by far.
The glooth has strange and sometimes negative side effects on plants and animals. Though it seems to be of natural origin I consider it a danger. Perhaps it is not so natural in the end.
Yes, I know them. I discovered this hidden cave during one of my rambles through the tunnels. I read the strange inscriptions but I never felt the urge to comply with their requests.

Yes, in these caves it seems to change in a strange way. There is a scientist who came here once to research this phenomenon. I guess her name is Georgia Rainbird. If you find her, she might tell you more.
I still have trouble with those annoying thieves - despite them having significantly weakened after your recent endeavours, though.

Some utterly annoying rascals rove about in these tunnels. They are stealing glooth based weaponry and devastate the flora and fauna down here. They threaten the natural balance. Would you go and eliminate some for me?
I knew you would be willing to help nature. Weed out two hundred of them. That should bring some relief for these caves.
I'm disappointed to hear that. If you change your opinion and are willing to help nature, come back to me.
A blessing often goes along with some sort of ritual cleansing. Perhaps a vial of holy water could help you.
You are lucky. Just this morning I consecrated some water for a healing ritual. I think I have a vial to spare.
I'm sorry but I already gave you a vial of holy water. I need the rest for my ritual.
Farewell.
Greetings. You don't have to shout, my ears are very good! Besides I'm quite busy, as you may see.
I'm Georgia Rainbird.
It's exactly 7:29 am.
I'm a scientist. I took great pains to build up this laboratory. Researching the glooth, its characteristics and risks is my self-imposed life task. ...
I do my researches even at the expense of my health.
This is a slimy substance which is produced by the glooth worms. It was a driving force for the progress in Rathleton. A substance that has great potential but also carries some risks.

Yes, in these caves it seems to change in a strange way. This mutation has negative side effects and must be stopped. Unfortunately I'm blind and can't fulfil some tasks any more. I need your eyes. Would you help me?

Yes, I lost my eyesight due to a failed experiment. Something went terribly wrong and half of my laboratory equipment exploded in an acidic plume. Thereafter everything was dark. The risks of the glooth, you know.

Splendid! So listen: I think I found a way to eliminate the mutated glooth by converting it back into its primal state. I have constructed a special device, a glooth converter - or at least, I was about to do so. ...
Then I lost my eyesight and wasn't able to finish my work. There are still some missing components. If you could obtain them, we might complete the converter. ...
Here, I give you the unfinished device, so you can mount the missing parts. Do you know what you need for the repair?
You need five special gear wheels I haven't in stock here in the laboratory. Furthermore the converter requires a glass tube, a valve and a specially calibrated indicator gauge.

They must have the appropriate size and toothing. I assume the rustheap golems out there in the caves are constructed with some of these gears. Perhaps also the glooth golems and metal gargoyles have some.
My former laboratory assistant Elbert has an appropriate tube. You might find him at one of the glooth pumping stations. ...
He is very engaged in maintaining these stations now, so unfortunately he can't assist me any more.
You might find a fitting valve in the caves down here. Perhaps you can demount one from a pipe or glooth tube out there.
It has to be a special indicator gauge. Elbert had already calibrated several gauges, but they were stolen by a gang of bandits. These impertinent thieves must have hidden them in their camp. ...
If you find the camp, you surely will find at least one of these gauges.
Yet, the mutated glooth hasn't been converted back to its primal state. I'm really happy about your backing. Are things going well?
Great. You and me, we will save Rathleton without them even knowing it up there!
Oh dear! What's the problem?

To complete the converter you need five special gear wheels I haven't in stock here in the laboratory. Furthermore the converter requires a glass tube, a valve and a specially calibrated indicator gauge.
There is a red mushroom that strangely resists all changes and detriments the mutated glooth causes in living beings. ...
Find one of these mushrooms and use the alchemical devices here in my laboratory to obtain a distillate of this mushroom.
I'm sorry, I know nothing about any statues.
Farewell.
Greetings. Excuse me but I don't have the time for useless conversation. I have a lot of work and unfortunately also some trouble here.
I oversee the glooth pumping stations down here. Formerly I was the laboratory assistant to Georgia Rainbird, but her research work ... how might I phrase it? It is in abeyance at the moment.
It's exactly 3:38 pm.
There is a band of thieves who bully the tunnels near the factory far too long. Even worse, they have stolen some important objects. ...

On the one hand there were some special gauges I calibrated for Georgia Rainbird. She surely needed them for some important purpose. Further they have stolen a vast amount of ammunition for new glooth-based weapons, so called glooth ejectors. ...
This ammunition consists of glooth-filled supply capsules. Would you help me and try to bring them back?
I'm very happy to hear that. If you have found ten glooth capsules talk to me again.
I'm very happy that you agreed to help me.
She is a very gifted scientist, researching the potential but also the risks of the glooth. Unfortunately she recently had an accident and received a severe injury that interferes with her work.
Yes, in these caves it seems to change in a strange way. This mutation has negative side effects. Ask Georgia Rainbird, she can tell you more.

This is a slimy substance which is produced by the glooth worms. It was a driving force for the progress in Rathleton. A substance that has great potential but also carries some risks. 58 Player: hi Ah, there you are! Do you bring back the stolen glooth supply capsules?
I'm sorry, that isn't enough yet. If you bring me ten capsules I will take them, of course.
Well, things can always change.
I'm sorry, I know nothing about any statues.
Farewell.
Hi! Are you the new assistant? No? Well then, I'll make you an honorary assistant.
Well, I'm kind of stuck here, as the control unit here need constant maintenance. <sigh> That's why I need someone to assist me in tending to the gloothworms.
The worms on the farm provide fresh, unused glooth. It's much sought after, both by the city and the scientists.
So you'll assist me? Great! Okay. You will look after the gloothworms - find out what they need and then do the associated task. ...
A daily routine implies at least three different tasks done. To receive a task, take a look at the gloothworm surveillance machine in the northern cave and then tell me what it says.
Is there a malfunction with the machine that prevents you from completing a task?
Oh. Okay. Do you want me to explain how the machine works?
The principle is simple. The machine measures soil humidity, toxic values and growth rate of the gloothworms through pipes filled with special reagents that connect it to the farm. ...
Those values are shown as code on the machine. To prohibit tampering with the machine, only I know what the code means and can give access to the machine. ...
If you want to assist me in a mission, all you have to do is this: Talk to me first. I'll then give you access to the machine. ...
Now, use the machine once to have it display a code. Come to me to report that code, and I'll tell you which task you need to do. Then, when you finished your task, report back to me. ...
When you have done three tasks in a row in this way, I'll give you a voting right as a reward. Want me to explain again?
Okay. Well, I'll just continue maintenance on this thing then. If you should be interested in assisting me again, come back anytime.
Ah! So, you can't complete your task or use the machine, yes? Do you want me to reset the data and start from the beginning?
Ah, okay. Do you want me to explain how the machine works, then?
I must tell you that this means you lose your current progress in the gloothworm tasks. Do you still want to reset all current tasks and start all over again?
Okay. Well, if you need help or want to assist me again, come back anytime.
Okay. Let me just reset this... and this. Okay. You can now start your tasks anew. If you want to assist me, talk to me about a mission.

Well, I like the city good enough. Some really nice people around, even though the island's small. But now with the shipping line to Venore and Thais, I'm sure things grow a little more interesting every day.
Bye!
Hi!
I'm one of the scientists that the magistrate ordered here to keep the plant running smoothly.
There is so much to do and so much to be learned. Every day here is an adventure on its own.
I mean the scientific part and the challenges. Those constant attacks on the plants are more something for heroes like you.
They should really value science and education far more. Knowledge it the most valuable resource a city can have.
I admit I'm afraid of them. They say our gates are sure and adventurers like you would protect us - but they are so many. And they never give up.
He had a brilliant mind and in my youth I was anxious to one day visit one of his classes. But there was this accident before I was grown up. ...
I guess it was an accident. Something drove his newest walker models mad and they went of a rampage, killing him in the process.
I heard he recently stopped some death priest or something like that from sinking our whole isle to the ocean floor.
People come and go. There is nothing out of the unusual bit the superstitious talk of workers.
Good bye.
Greetings, I advise you to stay inside the plant unless you feel prepared to face the danger outside!
We are under constant attacks by strange metal creatures from the south. Some are familiar like the glooth golems and the dreaded walkers but others are foreign to us but just as murderous of course.
Some were identified as golems of yalaharian design. But others are of designs like nothing we have ever seen. ...
There are control towers that boost the strength of the golems at a disturbing degree and there are batteries that recharge and so to say heal the attackers. ...
This should be your first targets in any fights. But the worst thing in the enemies arsenal is the glooth bomb for sure.

From inspecting golems from previous attacks we could figure that most of the golems are made up from golem scrap and don't fit perfectly together but they are as efficient enough to pose a serious threat. ...
Strangely enough some inner parts were often replaced with local technology and glooth components. This is for sure not the work of yalaharians but someone else with disturbingly high knowledge.
It's kind of a doomsday device, that can cause serious damage to our plant. It's slowly moving towards the plant and heavily armoured. The only way to stop it, is it's timely destruction.
Good bye!
Hi!
I'm the overseer of the new glooth plant of course
Rathleton hasn't yet reached its full potential but our new plant will change that.

Specifics are classified and only comprehensible by a glooth expert anyway but suffice to say that this plant will revolutionize the way Rathleton is supplied and lead us to all new heights in civilisation.
I'm certain after my work on the plant a position in the magistrate is the inevitable next stepping stone in my career.
It's a shame we can do that little to stop those brutes. In their envy they try to destroy our greatest accomplishment in history.
I don't think I have to discuss some stupid rumours with you. We both have more important things to do with our time.
Maxxen was a mediocre scientist at best. Sure he had a lucky hand in creating the walkers but that's it. He went mad and was killed by his own creations. ...
Still many of his malfunctioning walkers escaped and are still troubling us after all those years.
Ah, come on, I'm a man of science and don't believe in superstitious nonsense.
Good bye.
I'm just one of the workers here. I'll do all the dirty stuff, ye' know?
Just everything that those fine scientists are too good enough to do of course.
Never seen anything else. Neither I care. One city is enough for me. What could be different anywhere else.
I had worse jobs, regardless of the things they keep telling.
It's just nonsense. We simple people don't understand this glooth stuff and we don't need to. ...
But some people are afraid of things that they don't understand, then they start to make up stories.
Yeah, stupid nonsense stories.
important people doin' important stuff. Don't care. As long as I'm fed those people may do what they want with their busy things and so on.
Just what ya' need to make a lousy day even lousier. Their constant raids are a pain, ya' know. Someone should go and kill 'em all.
What is that? never heard about it.
Captain Caveworm is the peoples hero, fighting for the poor and weak.
Good bye.
Hi!
I'm a security guard of the plant.
The plant is of greatest value and has to be protected appropriately.
I think the magistrate should invest in some form of army. With all the threads and hand we few guardsmen are not numerous enough to fight back.
They will never give up. There will be no peace until all of them are dead.
That was the madman responsible for that walker incident. It many good men died that day but in the end order prevailed.
Spare me that nonsense.
We have everything under control and I have nothing to discuss with you. Move on. [walks away]
Good bye.
Greetings, I advise you to stay inside the plant unless you feel prepared to face the danger outside!
The minotaurs try to breach our defences. They employ several dirty tricks to do so, but the greatest threat comes from their wallbreaker.

The wallbreakers are beasts that they have bred as living siege weapons. How they manage to do that is an enigma to us but it seems at least they have only a very limited number of them at disposal and they don't get along too well with each other. ...

So in each of their attacks they will also employ one wallbreaker. Wallbreakers are slow and single minded bound to reach our plant. If they reach it, they'll breach it and this will result in an explosion. ...
The wallbreakers have to be stopped at any cost before they reach the plant!
They use mystic totems to heal their warriors. Unless the totems are destroyed, it is hard to finish their soldiers, so focus on the totems first. ...
Then there are the minotaurs that they pumped full with some potions that they create with stolen glooth.
In their glooth empowered state, they are next to unstoppable. Luckily we learned from previous attacks and our scientists installed several glooth extractors on the field. ...
When you manage to lure one of the powered minotaurs over an extractor, it will nullify the glooth effect and the beast should become easy to handle.
Good bye!
Hi there. I hope I can help you, I really do. Did you know that we worked on some revolutionary vehicles here? No? Oh well.
I work here. Doin' the stuff that I'm ordered to.
So, you are looking for some kind of vehicle to ease travelling around these parts? Well then ...
One of the teams I was in, recently conducted some experiments concerning some kind of glider. We were tasked with the actual flight of the thing. ...
However, we could never quite get that thing to do what we asked it to. Still, a revolutionary thing - incredible, really. It was glooth powered but don't get your hopes up just yet. ...
The only thing left from this project, are blueprints. We never got it to actually lift off. I know of some guy who claimed to have found a way - but that one is not working with us anymore. ...
If I remember correctly, his name was professor Pierre Zeronex. But beware, that guy can be... dangerous. ...
And even in case you find those plans, there are a lot of other factors and requirements to count in as well: ...

We are constantly raided by bandits, we need a certain amount of clean glooth, you would need a way to constantly 'power' the glooth its running on and there is the 'secret ingredient' from that weird Zeronex.
We usually draw blueprints before building anything. They also serve as documentation as well as base for prototypes, we also revise them often.
Never seen one. When they attack I keep me busy upstairs.
What about it? It's up there, above us.
No idea what they are doing. They tell us what to do and we do it.
No rain, not too cold in winter. It's not that bad.
Uh. Well. Things happen ye' know? Sometimes people gone missing. Bet is was the minotaurs or somethin'. Sometimes stuff happening, weird stuff.
Man, strange stuff I tell ya'. Things movin' while you are not looking. Strange noises. It's some minotaur curse.
Don't know all that science guys here by name, sorry.
Captain Caveworm a true hero and I know people who have seen him like my grandma.
Goodbye, still got some work to do. Check back later if you want.
Greetings, I advise you to stay inside the plant unless you feel prepared to face the danger outside!
It seems our plant causes the some local wildlife of the underground to go mad for some odd reason. We have no idea what's happening but the attacks of the beasts are undeniable. ...
The worst part is, that even creatures formerly unknown in this area, burrow their way to the plant. And some of these creatures are HUGE, I tell you
The whole area is undermined by a web of old and new tunnels. When such a tunnel opens, the best thing is to destroy it quickly, to keep it from allowing more and more creatures entrance.
The worst attacker is the occasional tremor worm as we have called them. They are enormous solitary beasts whose presence alone causes enough damage to threaten the stability of the plant. ...
Their digging and moving underground send tremors to the delicate machines in the plant and they often destroy parts of our cooling system. ...
This will sooner or later cause our systems to malfunction and some of them even to explode. ...
Causing massive damage to the plant. The only way to stop them, is to kill them before they caused too much damage to our systems.
Good bye!
<nods>
We're on a mission from above.
Elliott. What's yours, lady?
Nice making your acquaintance. We could perhaps meet for a pint of glooth after we finished this job.
Hey, how should I know?
You fixed some of those loose valves then? Let me check, ok?
Yeah, well, that's not enough yet. Need to have twenty or more of those valves tightened. Come back then, ok? Thanks.
This is the ancient part of it, not in good shape. Back in the old times, everyone just built their own canal under their house or shop and then left it at that. ...
City never bothered to really repair this place, it's just patch it up and go. Not too bad here, though, once you get used to the things.
<shrugs> Well, critters, monsters... you'll see. Most are cool and leave us alone. But they treat everything else as food, so don't be surprised if they bite ya. Kill them if you have to.
I heard those rot elementals and glooth blobs are real pests. Terrence has put out a reward for killing them.
