answer: Ah, the northern cities. One day I will start an extensive culinary expedition there. I have this dream of writing some sort of culinary guide, you know. Isn't that a great idea?
No djinn who is in his right state of mind would want to go there! What for? The land is ruled by an undead nut case, and from what I've heard his subjects are no better.
I've heard good things about this place. I understand the caliph is a true gourmet. People who eat good food can't be bad, that's what I say.
You want Bo'ques? Well, you've found him, I'd say.
Gabel used to be king, you know. I must confess I miss those days a bit because I was allowed to carry the title of his royal majesty's personal cook. Ah, those were the days.
He's my boss. A most loyal customer and a real con... conni... well, a man of taste, at any rate. His favourite dish is Scarabe au Vin served with onions and rice.
Yes! That's it! I have always trouble with pronouncing that damn word. A conno... conni... ah, hang it all!
That's our race. It has seen better days, you know. ...

It would have been better for us all if more djinns would share my interest in cooking. But no! Bashing each others' heads in is the only thing they are good at! Vandals and trogo ...trogli ... and cavemen, that's what they are!
A bunch of ignorants and primitives, that's what they are. You should see the things they eat! ...
You know they serve ketchup with just about every kind of meal! Ketchup! Oh, those barbarians.
That's us - the loyalists who have remained faithful to Gabel and to good cooking.
I totally agree with Gabel that djinns and humans can learn from each other. ...
Take cooking, for example. It has such a long tradition among humans - even I could still learn a thing or two from the famous cooks at king Tibianus' court!
That's a sad story, and like most djinns I dislike talking about it. Let's put it this way. Once there was a great cook who worked hard to prepare the finest meal of his life. ...
But when he found that the product of his efforts did not meet his expectations he just ditched it even though it was wonderfully unique in its own special way. ...
You know what I think? I think Zathroth was a bad cook.

Ah yes. That human WAS special, believe me. Did you know I talked to him myself, back in those days? In fact, I even had an argument with him because he dared to insult my work! He drove me mad when he called me a self-indulgent glutton. ...

But you know, eventually we came to respect each other! He taught me to stress quality rather than quantity, and he came to appreciate my 'Chilli con Cobra'. Today I know that having met him was a major step forward in my development as a culinary artist.
Apparently he is an undead! And what's worse, he actually chose that fate for himself! Undead! Imagine that! Never sleep, never laugh, and worst of all: Never eat!
Ah yes, the trader - right? I remember him. He used to travel the mountains with his mule. A tough haggler and a real scrooge, he was. I thought he had fallen down a cliff with all his money.

Ah - that guy. You probably don't know it, but nobody around here likes to hear that name. It brings back painful memories, you know. His betrayal was such a heavy blow to us. I think I will never understand what made him do it? It's a mystery.
That djinn is so engrossed in his work! I constantly have to remind him to eat because if I didn't, he would simply forget. Forgetting to eat! Can you imagine that?
Djema is a nice girl, but she eats so little. It's frustrating, really. Humans and their little stomachs!
I've never been much of a warrior, but I will storm into battle swinging my meat cleaver if necessary. We simply must win this war!
Who would like to live in a palace if there is never the delicious smell of freshly prepared food! I wouldn't want to live there. Neither for love nor for money.
As far as I know that is one of the Pharaoh's crazy ideas. Just a load of nonsense.
Hm. Is that some exotic spice? Hang on, I know! It is a kind of lizard stew - right?
You would not believe it, but those lamps are actually quite comfy. And on top of that they are immensely practical! Did you ever try to put one of your beds into your pocket?
Thank you for helping me retrieve the recipes I was missing.
Thanks again, for bringing me that book!
Goodbye. I'm sure you will come back for more. They all do.
Be greeted, human Simula. How can a humble djinn be of service?
My name is Haroun. At your service.
I am a merchant. Though I have not chosen this position for myself I have accepted the task with humility and devotion. ...
If you have the permission of Gabel to trade with me, I can sell you some useful magical equipment.
That is the name my honourable father chose for me.

Of course they were untrained and fought even worse than without them. Some, however, managed to squeeze themselves into an armor and became indeed somewhat tougher.

answer: I'm sorry, but we don't serve this route.

Many people who sailed to Darashia never returned because they were attacked by a ghost ship! I'd never sail there!
Good bye. Recommend us if you were satisfied with our service.
Hello, stranger! These caves must seem strange to you. I wonder what brings you here... maybe you are interested in some work? There are several tasks I could need a hand with.
My name is Ashari. Mh... everything all right? You look as if it has some meaning to you? Oh sorry, I hope I did not offend you.
I am the first voice amongst this community.
I am the leader of our people in worldly matters. I am the one who gives everyone its responsibilities and sees over our resources.

This world is unforgiving and barren. Little can be done about that, but those of the second generation left us with more than the sins of the ancestors. They also gave us a home, hope, and at least some meagre resources.
We do not know for how long sinners have lived and died here in the afterworld before some of the second generation saw the damnation that the deeds of the first brought upon them. ...
Second generation might have only been true for some of them. Some might have been third of fourth generation already, who knows. ...
They were free of some of the taint of their mothers and fathers, and saw through their lies. Saw them as the sinners that they were. ...
It became clear to them and their leader Feridil that only by distancing themselves from the sinful outcasts, they could begin the long walk on the road to salvation. ...

They drove off the sinners and claimed a small part of this afterworld for themselves. They chose a home near the entrance to the afterworld to make it easier for the wise of Abar Dendri to watch and ultimately judge them. ...
They also made note of each new sinner, that arrived in the afterworld. And they marked them, so they could later tell if a petitioner who came to join them, was of second generation at least. ...
They secured the resources that they needed and organised their harvest. That was how our community came to be.
Larfion, our shaman, knows more about such matters. He is the guardian of our souls.
We are bound together in our need to purify ourselves in this harsh afterworld. Our resources are limited and our enemies numerous. But it will help us to atone.
Meditation and hard work purify body and soul. But the taint runs deep.
This is but a mockery of the world of light. Here we do not live, but are not truly dead either. We are similar to the undead that roam these caves. But unlike them we have the hope to atone.
Meditation and hard work purify body and soul. But the taint runs deep.
This is but a mockery of the world of light. Here we do not live, but are not truly dead either. We are similar to the undead that roam these caves. But unlike them we have the hope to atone.
The tears of the earth give life and strength to our plants. Without them our lives would be even more miserable and hopeless. ...
We could easily starve and become prey for the creatures of the caves. The tears of the earth water our gardens and allow us to maintain a community and stay together. ...
Without them our community would shatter. And without our community we'd be lost with no chance of redemption or even survival.
The roots belong to the world tree. Its roots are what holds our whole world together. It is there the tears of the earth can be found.
Oh if you want to help me, you can lend me a hand watering our garden, cultivating wild magic for our shaman, collecting fire for our settlement. ...
You can also start by helping us sterilise the dangerous mushrooms that have been preventing us from entering our crystal mines. They are literally spreading like a disease lately. ...
If you manage to get all of this done in a single day, I will offer a bonus!

Thank you. We use the unscathed tears of the gods we found in these hellish depths to water our gardens. It is thanks to these that we can survive down here. The garden feeds us as the fire gives us warmth. ...

Take this vial and venture down the path of these depths to find the unspoilt cradle of tears. Oh - and please heed my words: there are old remains of the forest above down there. They seem connected to the cradle. Sometimes... they can come alive.
The world weeps for the sins of our ancestors. They are bitter but they are a gift. Even the tears of the world are full of life and hope.
Filigree flasks we create with our own crystal tools. Worthy vessels for the purest of tears. I already gave you one, you didn't lose it - did you?

Our shaman, Larfion, has asked me again to cultivate some of the wild magic for him that roams free in some nearby caverns. I do not know what this is for, but he seems to need quite much of this lately. ...
It is a demand we simply cannot fulfil with all our other tasks at hand. ...
Please take this receptacle to the magical cavern, you will recognise it when you are surrounded by magic. There are strangely coloured crystals down there but they are harmless. ...
You will need to concentrate to cultivate the wild magic there. Listen carefully as I will try to explain to you how this is done: ...

The most important thing is the order. First you gather 'fury magic' which usually appears red, second you should gather 'nature magic', appearing green. The third component to combine the two previous is 'fire magic' which should be fiery yellow. ...

To neutralise all three and complete the cultivation, you should add a tiny bit of 'water magic' which shimmers blue. The components in the receptacle will now melt to a physical form and form a dry, rough powder.
I already gave you that task, once you have gathered the flames, bring the urn back.
We use these unique urns to capture the harmless flames from the ashes of fire elementals. Didn't I already give one to you? Did you lose it?
I already gave you that task, once you have sterilised enough mushrooms, simply return to me.
If you manage to finish all our tasks within a single day, you will receive a special bonus. Return to me once you are finished.
Bye!
Farewell then.
I am sorry, it is not our custom to talk to outsiders. Please address our leader, Ashari.
What's this? An optically challenged entity called Player. How fascinating!
I'm the great librarian of this library of a once great city.
So much knowledge was lost in the great wars when we had to retreat to hidden places beneath the surface ...
Most of our data storages are lost and so are the means to read or recreate some of them ...
We had to use the primitive storage form of books to recreate some of the lost knowledge. In the past, we used far more advanced forms of storage ...
Such as bound spirits but also means your puny brain would never be able to comprehend.
It's a fine library, isn't it? All this knowledge! All those books!
Our books are written in 469, of course you can't understand them.
The language of my kind. Superior to any other language and only to be spoken by entities with enough eyes to blink it.
Our language is beyond comprehension by your lesser beings. It heavily relies on mathemagic ...
Your brain is not suited for the mathemagical processing necessary to understand our language ...
To decipher even our most basic texts, it would need a genius that can calculate numbers within seconds in his brain.
You pitiful two-eyed creatures. In our eyes, you look weird. It is pathetic how much you depend on hands and legs ...
Since we bonelords have more eyes than any creature in the world, it is obvious that you can determine the value of a species by the number of its eyes.
The world is full of inferior species. Once, our race ruled the whole world, but then the gods destroyed our empire ...
But our race is proficient in the return from death. One day we will rise again, that's for sure!
This city is nothing but a pale shadow compared to the cities of the past. Our race was forced to retreat to such insignificant underground outposts after the wars.
Our race has fought many wars in the past and has won most of them. Sometimes, though, it takes only one loss to bring a race down ...
All the more if the gods you are fighting for, turn out to be traitors.
Our race is very old. Over the time, we have been given many different names by other races ...
The term bonelord sticks to us for quite a while now ...
In our language the name of our race is not fixed but a complex formula, and as such it always changes for the subjective viewer.
I'm 486486 and NOT 'Blinky' as some people called me ... before they died. So don't ... confuse your numbers, as my kind says.
Interesting how foolish you are. Take this and see how long you'll last.
Numbers are essential. They are the secret behind the scenes. If you are a master of mathematics, you are a master over life and death.
Yes, yes, I'll kill you soon enough, now let me continue my investigations about you.
Go and wash your eyes for using this obscene number!
I heard that elves moved in upstairs.
They will mourn the day they abandoned us.
Their mages are so close to the truth. Closer than they know and closer than it's good for them.
Noisy pests.
Only inferior species need weapons.
It's 1, not 'Tibia', silly.
Ugliness incarnated. Only one eye! Imagine that! How horrible!
Good tools to work with ... once they are dead, that is.
These fools and their superstitious life cult don't understand anything of importance.
Wait right there. I'll eat you right after writing down what I found out.
Ah, a visitor to intimidate. Splendid!
An amusing question in its own, naive way. Let me put it this way: I have become an outcast, and am no longer free to move about my own city. ...
However, despite their limitations, my kind still regard me as useful. I can do .. things they can't or won't do. So I am of value to them. ...

I have gained magnificent insights into things lesser bonelords could only dream of at the price of losing touch with concepts common amongst my kin. An insignificant price to pay for the riches I have gained! ...
This makes me valuable .. for the moment. They come to me in secrecy to ask for my guidance in their petty schemes. ...
They need my genius for help and that makes them less inclined to get rid of me. If the incompetent fools mess up and things go horribly wrong then they have a scapegoat to blame - me. ...
However, I am just biding my time. One of these days, they will come for me .. and I'll be gone.
This city was built by enslaved corpses and souls. It oozes pain and despair. Just how my people like it. Sadly, it is only a pale memory of the past. ...

In ancient times our cities were symphonies of agony, choruses of lost souls. Ah, the marvels of long gone times. How pitiable, that we lack the resources to enslave your puny race to sculpt something as glorious as the cities of the past. ...
But, our time will come again! We merely need to wait. When the time comes, we will be ready. ...
All it needs is a well timed push in the right place, human, and we will retake our rightful place and the agonised screams of your kind will be music in our ears!

You only know my race from the remnants that are scattered through this world. These remnants are nothing when compared with those bonelords who grasped the world by its throat in the glorious days of our dominance! ...
We were the rulers, the ultimate masters. Fate and the Gods betrayed us. Stole what was rightfully ours. But we have survived. We are still here. What once was ours will become ours again. ...
We just have to wait. Patience is our power.

Be grateful that you can't even hope to grasp the concept behind my name. When I was more... active and had dealings with your race, captured specimens referred to me in your language as 'dreadeye'. ...
While they still had the ability to speak, that is. That will have to suffice.

Only true bonelords can understand our language. Even I in my... changed state have a hard time understanding even the simple parts of our writings and some parts of it are completely alien to me now. ...
You, human, will never understand our language as you will never understand our ways.
A vain and elusive race. Powerful enough to defy the Gods... so they thought. Now their power is gone, their race declined. They exist still, broken, bereft of any true power. ...
They are as good as dead. With our expertise in necromancy, we recognize the signs of death when we see them. Unlike us bonelords they will never rise again.
What you understand under the term necromancy is only the tip of the iceberg compared to what we are doing, puny human. We are the masters of souls. ...
Creators, shapers, masters. Ours is a complete realm beyond your understanding. Our knowledge borders the realms of apotheosis and it is only a matter of time until the final step is taken.

You could not hope to understand it anyway. But we were close. So close that the Gods struck down our empire and our race. But we survived. We are still here. And our time will come. You can't delay the inevitable.
He is a desperate fool, turning to me for guidance, for those who deal with us pay a high price - they serve us as undead slaves for eternity, muhaha! ...
And a lucky fool for I have my reasons to oblige his request.
Ah yes, the issue of golems. I know. Much of the knowledge on this subject that my race have... acquired over the centuries is at my disposal. ...

And I am disposed to share it. Ah, I guess you are surprised, mortal? Well there are... issues you cannot possibly hope to understand with your limited mind. Actually I can hardly comprehend them myself. ...

But my madness brings certain insights. There is no need to understand, there is only the need to do what has to be done. I will make sure one of my messengers delivers Telas the information he requires. ...
I hope he does not scare easily.
Bye. Think twice before you return here.
I greet you - and I have to ask you to... just tell me if you have something for me.
I'm the spiritual guide and keeper of knowledge for this community.
We are the shame born, the repenters, the pardoners. The sins of our ancestors are the poison in our souls and our shame in the eyes of those born in the light of the suns.
Our ancestors were outcasts and evil. We still bear their taint and shame. No such sinner is allowed in our ranks, but we welcome all those born down here.
Only who is of the second generation can atone for the unspeakable sins that led to the punishment of the ancestors.
The suns are the eternal eyes of the great judge. He who is the justice of the purified.
All those who are born without sin in the light of the suns are purified in death. Unlike us tainted ones.

We are unclean because of the sins of our ancestors. In this harsh afterworld we are allowed to distance us from the ancestors and atone for their sins. If we die here, we are damned into nothingness.
Only if we live in purity and humility, we might find pardon in the eyes of the lightborn.
Those who are born under the light of the suns, are born pure. Unlike us. They live a life in light, splendour and without hunger, thirst or fear. They are wise and just and watching us.
If they deem us worthy, they will take us into the light on the day of the prophecy.
Our ancestors were soaked with evil. They were vile criminals that were cast out of the light and the lands of splendour that the ancestors called Abar Dendri.
The wise judges of Abar Dendri spoke justice and they spoke true. No outcast was ever to see the light of the suns again. No single life could atone for their sins.
Through those wise words they gave a clue. A shed of hope which they bestowed upon the sinners in their wisdom and mercy.
But they were blinded by the darkness of the afterworld, they have been banished and their minds were clouded by the evil of their sins.

Only Feridil of the second generation was enlightened enough to see what those words meant. He gathered the second born, slew the sinners and drove off those who escaped to cast them deeper into darkness.
Then the great judge spoke to him in a vision. He showed him the path to salvation by purifying the blood by generations of atonement.
Abar Dendri it is! As the words of the repenters that came before us told us. It is the land of plenty, without any need and where the light always shines and it is warm without a fire.
In their wisdom the wise of Abar Dendri provided the children of the sinners with an harsh environment to work off the sins through hard work.
With every drop of sweat and blood that is shed in our suffering a little bit of the ancestors sinfulnesses is driven out.
Only by enduring this trial we can better ourself. It is a slow process, since obviously the ancestors' sins were grave.
If we needed any proof for that, the fact that the wise of Abar Dendri have not yet deemed us worthy to return into the light should show any doubter that we are not cleansed yet.
We are not worthy to be elves, perhaps one day the children of our children might see the light again. We have to suffer for our children and for a better future for them.
Talk to Ashari over there.
Yes, well you see, I am... waiting for something. Did Ashari tell you anything? Or ask you to do something?
Then you are wasting both our time.
I don't suppose you already have anything for me then? Oh well. Maybe you should go... talk to Ashari again.
Yes, yes erm - goodbye.
Goodbye? Yes, well, goodbye then.
LEAVE THE DRAGONS' CEMETERY AT ONCE!
AHHH MUSHRRROOOMSSS! NOW MY PAIN WILL BE EASSSED FOR A WHILE! TAKE THISS AND LEAVE THE DRAGONSSS' CEMETERY AT ONCE!
Welcome, Player! May earth protect you on these rocky grounds. If you need a passage back, I can help you.

answer: This is a steamship that travels only subterraneously. No way to get on that risky ocean.
Aw man, that's what I miss most. I think the ridiculous amount of a few dozen barrels barely lasted a day. Time for resupplying!
I fear I don't have anything to sell. In fact, it's hard to buy anything around here.
Yes, that's me. At your service.
With the base improved and supplied I can offer you a cheaper steamboat passage. So you want to go to Cormaya? 50 gold?
Well, then you stay here, simple as that.
I remember playing with Gurbasch and Brodrosch when I was still a really young dwarf. Ages ago! A shame they don't remember as well as I do. Maybe because I made them eat worms and the like.
Oh yes, you could call me an inventor. A technomancer, inventor and captain. And a fearless explorer at that.

I'm proud to say that I'm the first dwarf who steered a steamship through the great northern subterraneous river and found a way to reach this large cave which will hopefully become a prospering dwarven city someday.
With the base improved and supplied I can offer you a cheaper steamboat passage. Do you want to go to Kazordoon for 150 gold?
Well, then you stay here, simple as that.
Where do you want to go, Kazordoon or Cormaya?
Do you see this amazing new technology? The imperial mining guild funded the research to build this baby. With it we can travel faster and farther than ever before.
I'm also a technomancer, true. I took part in inventing and developing this revolutionary new steamship.
Earth under your feet ... it's still better than lava.
Hello. I hope you are here for a trade.
Yes, I sell spears. Ask me for a trade if you're interested to see my wares.
I sell all sorts of arrows for bows and different bolts for crossbows. Ask me for a trade if you're interested to see my wares.
I have normal arrows, sniper arrows, flaming arrows, shiver arrows, flash arrows, earth arrows and onyx arrows used with bows. Just ask me for a trade.
I have bolts, piercing bolts and power bolts used with crossbows.
I don't buy used bows. If you want to buy one, just ask me for a trade.
Well, for now we got some modest comfort down here. At least, I don't feel like some primitive cave dweller anymore.
I'm sure this is a land full of opportunities. Sadly, I'm extremely occupied down here with important tasks for my superiors. They wouldn't allow me to explore the land on my own ...
For people like you though, it's an amazing possibility you shouldn't miss. Someone as powerful and clever as you has to fear little and to gain much.
I don't buy used crossbows. If you want to buy one, just ask me for a trade.
Well, I sell spears, bows, crossbows and ammunition for distance fighting. Ask me for a trade if you're interested to see my wares.

They are neglectable as they have nothing to offer. They live in horrible primitive conditions, but we are not here for charity work. As long as they don't have anything interesting to offer, we will simply ignore them.
Now that the negotiations have been successful, I have opened up a small business to buy and sell certain wares ...
Of course my inventory is limited by the restrictions of this fledgling base. I hope I can expand my dealings here as soon as the work on the base progresses.
Well, for an underground town it's probably not that bad. Still, you have to be a dwarf to like it.
They are an incredible threat. At the moment, they are occupied with the orcs. But once they are done with the orcs, who will be next? They might even plan to conquer human civilisation... ...
I agree with my superiors that a preventative strike will be the best solution. The lizards' cities are rich and the land offers plentiful resources that would easily cover the costs of a war.
The mines do well. If only the miners would loosen their purse strings.
The imperial mining guild is one of the toughest institutions in the known world to negotiate with. Everything you tell them will be discussed by an unknown number of elders behind closed doors. ...
Sometimes negotiations come to a halt for weeks, then they continue for a few minutes until they call for the next break to discuss further things.
It's amazing how they enslaved the orcs. I already wrote a report home. I wonder if this cheap labour couldn't be used in some efficient way ...
For now I try to figure out how to convince the minotaurs to open up some form of trade, but that will prove difficult if not impossible.
He can be quite stubborn sometimes but I see why they chose him to head this venture. ...
If you've ever talked to dwarfs, you'll recognise that he is an rather open-minded and flexible fellow.

Of course they are dangerous. But we all know: Orcs can die, can't they? And speaking of that, they might have stolen some interesting stuff from these lizardmen that could be of some value for someone with an exotic taste.
I think they are content with the state of the base and will fully concentrate on the mines now.
My superiors are a board of tree traders from Venore who are looking for new opportunities.
Just browse through my wares. After I've seen those interesting patterns I've also grown more interested in all sorts of flags or banners. If you find any I'll gladly buy them.
My lovely hometown was always at the forefront of science, exploration and daring ventures. I see some profitable opportunities in this project, and I'm in constant correspondence with my superiors.
Bye.
Another visitor to this constricted, cosy, calm realm, perfect except for an exit. Muhaha.
It's you, why did they throw you in here again? Anyway, I will just transform you once more. I also recovered your crate which will wait for you at the exit. There, feel free to go.
I wait. I wait for someone like you to come here. I wait for them to grow disconsolate. I wait for them to despair. And I wait for them to die. Muhahaha.
I am Zumtah, Zumtah the impeccable, Zumtah the marvellous, Zumtah the... the... eternal.
The land you are currently dwelling in, human. Don't you have any sense of your surroundings?
I have seen many of them. I have seen many of them die. In here, with me. Perhaps you will be pleased to meet them. Not long and you will join their ranks. Muhaha.
Pesky creatures. Many of them have been brought here, many of them died here. Humans, lizards, beasts, they all die the same. Down here, with me. Muhahaha.
What? What do you mean by that?
Hmm, an old one. I don't care much about politics or power, as here, he has none. Here, only I have power. Muhaha.
What are you talking about, such things do not matter down here. Down here alone, isolated and broken. Muhaha.
Muhahaha.
Welcome, adventurer Player! What brings you here?

Building the temple is progressing slowly, but steadily. It's not all about setting up statues, you know - you also need to pray to the right spirits and channel the energies that flow through this mountain.
This temple has a slow start but we dwarfs are patient like stone. One day, this temple might become an important place, particularly when thinking of the sickness of this land.
There is a force of corruption at work in this land. It is not the destruction caused by humanoids but something else. ...
It's like a hidden plague. Something that takes away the strength of earth and life itself. ...
I have no idea what it is or what its source might be, but its presence haunts me even in my dreams.
Keep your adventurer's stone well.

Whenever you receive a lethal wound, your vital force is damaged and there is a chance that you lose some of your equipment. With every single of the five blessings you have, this damage and chance of loss will be reduced.

There are five blessings available in five sacred places: the spiritual shielding, the spark of the phoenix, the embrace of Tibia, the fire of the suns and the wisdom of solitude. Additionally, you can receive the twist of fate here. ...
There are also two enhanced blessings for further reduction of experience loss.
I'm Prezil.
The embrace of the earth is strong here. I can feel ancient powers running just like veins of ore run through a mountain. ...
But I also sense a sickness that is spreading. Something unhealthy winds its way through the streams of power in this land. ...
It is not very strong here, but I can feel its source far in the north. ...
I'm able to ward it off our base for now, but it will become stronger and stronger with each year passing.
These mines are not like the ones we know from back home. Something is different in this new land.
I can sense that the druids north of Carlin have provided you with the Embrace of Tibia.
I can sense you already talked to the hermit Eremo on the isle of Cormaya and received this blessing.
I can see you received the blessing of the two suns in the suntower near Ab'Dendriel.
I see you received the spiritual shielding in the whiteflower temple south of Thais.
I can sense that the spark of the phoenix already was given to you by the dwarven priests of earth and fire in Kazordoon.

It is said that one enhanced blessing, the 'heart of the mountain', has been lost in the icy wastes of Svargrond. Find a nomad far to the west of these barren lands, hiding in the cold there, slightly above ground. ...

It is also said that a mysterious djinn, bound to an existence of slavery, lies buried somewhere beneath the northern Tiquanda jungle. I cannot confirm whether this tale is true but if you find him, you shall also find the 'blood of the mountain'.
Kazordoon is the cradle of dwarvenhood. Stepping out of the cradle might be a great adventure but it also carries some risks.
The guild puts its attention on physical matters, but they respect the traditions. This is important and the guild is an important part of our society.
It takes time to make progress and stabilise it. Haste is the enemy of stabilisation. Take your time and wait and see how things will evolve.
Just ask in which of the five blessings you are interested in.
It's obvious that a new path often leads to new enemies. Now that the path has been chosen, we'll have to cope with the problem.
Dragons that rule over an empire of minions are an alarming turn of events. I never heard that dragons did something like this before. ...
Those changes confuse me but we will adapt in the course of time.
Orcs are a known threat - an enemy we know all too well. At least we know how to handle them. However, their strange alliance with the minotaurs is something that we've only noticed now.
We'll see if they keep their word. We'll see if they hold the reigns of the orcish horde. And we'll see how long they will survive in this savage land at all.
For a rather young dwarf, he is quite competent. Give him a few more centuries and he'll become a great leader.
Farewell, Player!
Hail, traveller. You are still living, aren't you?
A jest! It is good to hear that you are alive indeed. I take it you aren't afraid?
Your fear to answer truly tells me you feel detached from this world, safe. ...

Fear is with all of us, driving us, yet ruining our lives all the same. Learn to control instead of ignoring it. If you truly are without fear, then abandon this path, there's naught to gain but death.
What with all the death around you, now a tree talking to you in your own tongue - aren't you afraid?
Yes, and there is much to fear. But you are strong and can control it. Key to victory in these dead plains is to avoid the great plague that has come to this land. ...
The plants, animals, all the things you see and don't see are afflicted. Death spreads its wings and wants to carry all living things away and into his realm. But there is another difficulty. ...

The warmth. T'is missing from this place now. Before you came here, I was the last breathing thing down here. This very spot graced by the last glimpse of our constant, fiery suns. My warmth, t'was the last sign of life. ...

Miss Eleonore is so charming, so beautiful. Her strong will and her independence poses surely a great challenge to every man who wants to marry her ...

The times are hard though and as long as evil pirates and murderous quara steal and destroy much of our property ...
it is hard enough to earn a living, not to mention financing explorations that could easily wait another year or two.
I heard he has some relation to these isles. To learn more about it, you probably talk to the mage from Edron that resides in a tower here in the city.
Governor Silverhand is such a fine person. He does so much for the city and receives so little in return. I hope we can cheer him up now and then ...
That's the least we can do for this great man that sacrifices himself for the good of his people.

And this unholy influence on this poor young Tristan whom she seduced with her beauty. I must admit, I am concerned.
I am honoured to humbly serve as the spokesman of the Venorean trading companies.

As soon as we have the pirates eliminated, we can lower many of the restrictions we had to enforce for the safety of all.

We have to see that the little profit we make will be enough to cover our expenses in the remote future ...

Thais finally brought order to the locals that were torn from fightings and hunger before our arrival.

These creatures pose a constant threat to all we have established so far. They could destroy everything we have worked for so hard ...

I can see you received the blessing of the two suns in the suntower near Ab'Dendriel.

I see you received the spiritual shielding in the whiteflower temple south of Thais.

The twist of fate will not reduce the death penalty like the other blessings, but instead prevent you from losing your other blessings as well as the amulet of loss, should you wear one. It costs the same as the other blessings. ...
